commit_message:
Removing tempest container build

The tempest container was used with validate-tempest, which is right now
deprecated, and all the jobs running upstream are using os_tempest,
which doesn't rely on containerized tempest, but only on the rpm
packages and/or install tempest directly from git.
The tempest container image is no longer being used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/778447

Related-Bug: #1916875

Change-Id: I4dc869019a04bf092f8c219e470be55f3bc682d3

commit_message:
Remove enable_tempest flag from tripleoclient

Since tempest container is no longer tested in CI and is
replaced with os_tempest ansible-role.

An user can use and install tempest from rpm which is
supported as earlier.

It removes all the entry point of tempest container.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/771993

Related-Bug: #1916875

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2e2c126aa95589a8d26eaec9626abbf4a86044ca

commit_message:
Remove undercloud_enable_tempest var

Since we are working in process of removing tempest container
from wallaby release and all the tempest run is switched to
os_tempest for all supported release in tripleo-ci.

This change is not going to affect any periodic jobs also.

It also removes run_tempest and tempest_format var.

Related-Bug: #1916875

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3d046047833044fd2d75ba399f784be5d992fbef

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-05 17:25:48.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] zuul jobs: make it clearer that OVN+OVS packages are being used

For jobs using OVN, it may be a little confusing that we are no longer building
and installing it from source. As jobs install OVN (and OVS) from package [0],
this change removes potentially confusing lines. Using packages is
faster and gives a more stable version, so there is nothing here challenging
its merits.

For folks interested in launching zuul jobs using a specific repo and
branch of OVN, use gerrit [1] as a reference. And do not forget to reply
with the comment 'recheck experimental' to trigger the job.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/763402
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763403

Change-Id: Iad88a56ea48475cb59b6684c528bcbb0c811761d

commit_message:
[OVN] zuul: make it clearer OVN+OVS packages are being used

As jobs install OVN (and OVS) from package [0], this change removes potentially
confusing lines.

For folks interested in launching zuul jobs using a specific repo and
branch of OVN, use gerrit [1] as a reference. And do not forget to reply
with the comment 'recheck experimental' to trigger the job.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/763402
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/763403

Change-Id: Iad88a56ea48475cb59b6684c528bcbb0c811761d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 21:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for share snapshot instance export locations

This commit updates the policies for share snapshot instance export locations
to understand scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of
a broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I493f4e3bdca141b08ed8a6fbeb8b9d461e3d8118
'}, {'created': '2021-01-12 07:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for share snapshot instance export locations

to understand scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of

experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I493f4e3bdca141b08ed8a6fbeb8b9d461e3d8118
'}, {'created': '2021-03-08 14:43:59.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for share snapshot instance export locations

This commit updates the policies for share snapshot instance export locations
to understand scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of
a broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I493f4e3bdca141b08ed8a6fbeb8b9d461e3d8118
'}]
commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share snapshot instance export locations

This commit updates the policies for share snapshot instance export locations
to understand scope checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of
a broader series of changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC
experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I493f4e3bdca141b08ed8a6fbeb8b9d461e3d8118

[{'created': '2021-02-26 06:20:09.000000000', 'message': "Add name to verbose compact output

We have a verbose option in s-m-s-r and when you get to the final
collapse into root with the compact command, it can look a little
screwy:

  $ swift-manage-shard-ranges --conf /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf /mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/containers/925/c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a.db  compact
  Loaded db broker for AUTH_admin/shardme.
  Donor shard range(s) with total of 0 objects:
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: active    upper: ''
  can be compacted into acceptor shard range:
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: sharded   upper: ''
  Once applied to the broker these changes will result in shard range compaction the next time the
  sharder runs.

So if you pass the --verbose flag the name is added to the output:

  $ swift-manage-shard-ranges --verbose  --conf /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf /mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/containers/925/c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a.db  compact
  Loaded db broker for AUTH_admin/shardme.
  Donor shard range(s) with total of 0 objects:
       name: '.shards_AUTH_admin/shardme-7820d6e9550a1661e01e0538aea8cc1b-1614319760.63229-5'
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: active    upper: ''
  can be compacted into acceptor shard range:
       name: 'AUTH_admin/shardme'
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: sharded   upper: ''
  Once applied to the broker these changes will result in shard range compaction the next time the sharder runs.
  Do you want to apply these changes? [y/N]

This also works any time you use the compact command:

  sharder runs.

But it's fixed if we add the name to the compact output. It also makes
gives it just a little bit more useful information:

commit_message:
Add name to compact output

Currently when you get to the final collapse into root with the compact
command, it can look a little screwy:

  $ swift-manage-shard-ranges --conf /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf /mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/containers/925/c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a.db  compact
  Loaded db broker for AUTH_admin/shardme.
  Donor shard range(s) with total of 0 objects:
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: active    upper: ''
  can be compacted into acceptor shard range:
    objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: sharded   upper: ''
  Once applied to the broker these changes will result in shard range compaction the next time the
  sharder runs.

But it's fixed if we add the name to the compact output. It also makes
gives it just a little bit more useful information:

  $ swift-manage-shard-ranges --conf /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf /mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/containers/925/c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a.db  compact

  Donor shard range(s) with total of 0 objects:
    '.shards_AUTH_admin/shardme-7820d6e9550a1661e01e0538aea8cc1b-1614319760.63229-5'
      objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: active      upper: ''
  can be compacted into acceptor shard range:
    'AUTH_admin/shardme'
      objects: 0         lower: ''
      state: sharded     upper: ''
  Once applied to the broker these changes will result in shard range compaction the next time the sharder runs.
  Do you want to apply these changes? [y/N]

This is what a non root collapse would look like with more ranges:

  $ swift-manage-shard-ranges --conf /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf /mnt/sdb1/1/node/sdb1/containers/925/c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a/e77a449c51d01ef47471efb208c20c2a.db  compact

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-13 05:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Replace dequeue_from_legacy_queue in documentation

When I tried to follow documentation, the expirer said:

 object-expirer[391675]: This node is not configured to dequeue
    tasks from the legacy queue.

Our documentation was incorrect, the actual name of the option is
"dequeue_from_legacy".

Change-Id: I5ca7ac589a405d0b6250922aa9bcaabecb3c4fb0
'}]
commit_message:
Replace dequeue_from_legacy_queue in documentation

When I tried to follow documentation, the expirer said:

 object-expirer[391675]: This node is not configured to dequeue
    tasks from the legacy queue.

Our documentation was incorrect, the actual name of the option is
"dequeue_from_legacy".

Change-Id: I5ca7ac589a405d0b6250922aa9bcaabecb3c4fb0

commit_message:
[ci] Part 2: Temporarily set docs job to non-voting

We set the check job to non-voting, but the
sporadic failures are occurring in the gate
queue as well. Unfortunate as it is, we're
still unable to fix the root cause.

Change-Id: I5a70441ee493ef6f5a5db1957000ee1134e3e5df
Partial-Bug: #1918707
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Added admins view all volume_admin_metadata

This patch adds the ability for admins only to view
volume_admin_metadata when fetching volumes from the API.

Change-Id: I25e950c041b8d2f556d1409aa8087d28175d1369

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share servers

This commit updates the policies for share servers to understand scope checking
and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of changes
across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve security.

Change-Id: Ib6645980a84e911431862680161b48c4ff8ea494

commit_message:
Add `rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold` config option

This change adds the `rabbit_heartbeat_timeout_threshold` config
option to the charm.

Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
Depends-On: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/588
Change-Id: I8c40fcce0a19fa7a5b9b6051fa39cedec60fe687

Add Python3 xena unit tests

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I630c3d946b4bdf18ad515c31d61a8f4a8c6e10d4

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2021-03-13 04:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 19:57:31.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iad0b9a98796f5d162ab2b9c66c60deb75b8ac2de
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iad0b9a98796f5d162ab2b9c66c60deb75b8ac2de

Add a new subclass, HeatPodLauncher to launching an emphemeral Heat
within a podman pod. The pod contains separate processes for Heat API
and engine, allowing for multiple engine workers (defaults to cpu
logical core count / 2).

The pod makes use of the undercloud's already installed database and
message bus.

commit_message:
Add HeatPodLauncher

Add a new subclass, HeatPodLauncher to launching an emphemeral Heat
within a podman pod. The pod contains separate processes for Heat API
and engine, allowing for multiple engine workers (defaults to cpu
logical core count / 2).

The pod makes use of the undercloud's already installed database and
message bus.

Change-Id: Ie8b4a5ca83284f66dceae32c6f2fc99cdc8c9ffb
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

  -https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file

Change-Id: Ie26b6ecbff69416b64271dbf4e253b187906f720

commit_message:
Update train release to c8 stream repos/image

8-stream - BaseOS, AppStream, PowerTools, HighAvailability, extras,
8 - ceph-nautilus, ceph-octopus, collectd-5

Pull centos-8 stream repos when running jobs on
the train branch.
Check jobs will match integration jobs - the repos
for which are being updated in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/778554

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-02 05:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add parameter to specify ca_cert

When generating a system certificate, the templates the value for the
ca cert path to the CA cert created by the local certmonger cert.
For an IPA generated cert, there is no way to specify a different
CA cert location.  This patch adds the ability to do that.

Change-Id: Iad3a51bc853d3e868fd38dbeca8c20dd32725723
'}, {'created': '2021-03-11 22:02:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add parameter to specify ca_cert

When generating system certificates, the templates set the values
of InternalTLSCAFile and PublicTLSCAFile to the file path for the
local CA cert created by certmonger.

This value is invalid for an IPA generated certs.  This patch sets
these values correctly to the default IPA CA cert location
(/etc/ipa/ca.crt)

Change-Id: Iad3a51bc853d3e868fd38dbeca8c20dd32725723
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameter to specify ca_cert

When generating system certificates, the templates set the values
of InternalTLSCAFile and PublicTLSCAFile to the file path for the
local CA cert created by certmonger.

This value is invalid for an IPA generated certs.  This patch sets
these values correctly to the default IPA CA cert location
(/etc/ipa/ca.crt)

Change-Id: Iad3a51bc853d3e868fd38dbeca8c20dd32725723

commit_message:
exclude neutron-server-opendaylight containers in queens, rocky, stein

As the neutron-server-opendaylight container is not build
through the container build push jobs, added that in the
exclude list containers list so that it will not cause an issue
at promotion.

commit_message:
Fix memcached firewall condition

The conditions should have used map_merge, this simplifies
them a lot, by passing a list to dport key.

Change-Id: I15cb1f3bbc9e1be90265feab5bfed7f28c1cb1f3
Closes-Bug: #1918891
Co-authored-By: yatinkarel <ykarel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add delegate_fact_hosts: false on ci scenarios

This change adds delegate_facts_hosts: false to the
existing ceph-ansible scenarios.
This was introduced due to the --limit option to avoid
gathering facts, but since we're running on standalone
and the same node is present in all groups, having that
variable set to True (which is the ceph-ansible default)
makes no sense.

Change-Id: I44433731f73882f62591e8067743beec4d423ef7
(cherry picked from commit c0e8697550bba624bd935d5ad01135a1d10094e9)

commit_message:
Moves upgrade and update jobs into the upgrades-jobs-templates.yaml

As part of [1] let's also tidy up the upgrade and update jobs. They
currently are defined in the various undercloud/multinode/standalone
templates. However now we have a dedicated upgrades jobs templates
file let's move the definitions there instead.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Change-Id: I1f7f0a1aa65e82f094abba1e2d8583ea04800e3b

commit_message:
Fix issue with scale down and overcloud TLS

Adding RootStackName variable to the scale tasks so that
we can reference it instead of the existing environment
variables. This will ensure that the scale down uses the
environment variables from clouds.yaml and get the
OS_CACERT while trying to speak with the overcloud endpoints

Change-Id: Ia8868172fb16b294208ee3d6b03c09442fe39443
Closes: #1913275

1: if we extend share, Are share size allowed to exceed the set default value? Currently, only the   creation of share is restricted.

> 2: before set share size limit we create a share, which size is 5G, then we config default share size is 3G, do we allowed shrink share size to 4G?
> 3: now, we create share must use share type or default share type, how do you think add share size limit to share type? for example:https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/765975

1. Yes, the patch restrict only during creation. The patch is derived from https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/185906

commit_message:
Add config option to set per_share_size_limit.

This feature allows admin to set share size limit for a project.
The defaults will either come from the default values
set in the quota configuration option or via manila.conf
if the user has configured default values for quotas there.

The quota_per_share_gigabytes defaults to -1["No Limit"] always
unless changed in manila.conf by admin.

Closes-Bug: #1811943

Change-Id: Ida126c8c419b8bf4d2a194f061a0809d52b47ab8

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for shares

This commit updates the policies for
shares to understand scope checking and
account for a read-only role. This is
part of a broader series of changes
across OpenStack to provide a consistent
RBAC experience and improve security.

Change-Id: I6d947fa5f51f6a462f0ce5b1f4b3c00d3a10b024
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Lower MysqlInnodbBufferPoolSize to its old 128M default

Since Ie274854a73bf6fe3d99e8621175f81c69c9a878a merged we defaulted
MysqlInnodbBufferPoolSize to 1G. Let's keep it the same old 128M default
on smaller envs where memory is short.

Change-Id: I65b3d83a234d3d3e85c1aa1918dedc75c79dbec2

I would add rgw zone rgw zonegroup as variables in values yaml. This become critical if we deploy the object store in multizone mode.'}, {'account_id': 28372, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30495, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:47:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> I would add rgw zone rgw zonegroup as variables in values yaml. This become critical if we deploy the object store in multizone mode.

Specifying the zonegroup, zone, index-pool and data-extra pool for each placement-target is needed for completeness but this PS satisfies our current needs. If we ever do need to specify the zone, zonegroup, etc it would be pretty easy to update the chart. For now I think having to specify 5 vars for each placement-target just increases the chances of user input error and would really be premature optimization. If it's acceptable I'd like to keep it as is for now."}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:18:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?

I was just following precedent. That is where all the other rgw related scripts are located.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?
> 
> I was just following precedent. That is where all the other rgw related scripts are located.

Looking at the configmap, there was only one of the scripts in the helm toolkit before yours was added.'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 9:
> > > 
> > > This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?
> > 
> > I was just following precedent. That is where all the other rgw related scripts are located.
> 
> Looking at the configmap, there was only one of the scripts in the helm toolkit before yours was added.

Actually I was using the create_s3_user script as the template which just happens to be the one in the toolkit. I can move the script if anyone really thinks it belongs in the rgw bin dir I can make the change but that would mean another round of testing.'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2021-03-10 16:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > I would add rgw zone rgw zonegroup as variables in values yaml. This become critical if we deploy the object store in multizone mode.
> 
> Specifying the zonegroup, zone, index-pool and data-extra pool for each placement-target is needed for completeness but this PS satisfies our current needs. If we ever do need to specify the zone, zonegroup, etc it would be pretty easy to update the chart. For now I think having to specify 5 vars for each placement-target just increases the chances of user input error and would really be premature optimization. If it's acceptable I'd like to keep it as is for now.

It's possible to infer defaults for empty values by using the `default` sprig method.

eg

    {{ $foo := .myValue | default "bar" }}

This way, not all values need to be specified in values.yaml'}, {'account_id': 30777, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 9:
> > > 
> > > > Patch Set 9:
> > > > 
> > > > This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?
> > > 
> > > I was just following precedent. That is where all the other rgw related scripts are located.
> > 
> > Looking at the configmap, there was only one of the scripts in the helm toolkit before yours was added.
> 
> Actually I was using the create_s3_user script as the template which just happens to be the one in the toolkit. I can move the script if anyone really thinks it belongs in the rgw bin dir I can make the change but that would mean another round of testing.

The create_s3_user / bucket scripts are in HTK, and so are the job spec templates (helm-toolkit/template/manifests/_job_s3_bucket.yaml.tpl).

I think the intention was to allow other helm charts the ability to create thier own S3 users / buckets in a standardized way. Do we anticipate the need for charts to create their own placement targets? Or should this configuration be solely managed by the ceph-rgw chart?'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:16:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> >

> > > 
> > > > Patch Set 9:
> > > > 
> > > > > Patch Set 9:
> > > > > 
> > > > > This looks fine, but not sure why the shell script is being created in the helm toolkit. Any reason why?
> > > > 
> > > > I was just following precedent. That is where all the other rgw related scripts are located.
> > > 
> > > Looking at the configmap, there was only one of the scripts in the helm toolkit before yours was added.
> > 
> > Actually I was using the create_s3_user script as the template which just happens to be the one in the toolkit. I can move the script if anyone really thinks it belongs in the rgw bin dir I can make the change but that would mean another round of testing.
> 
> The create_s3_user / bucket scripts are in HTK, and so are the job spec templates (helm-toolkit/template/manifests/_job_s3_bucket.yaml.tpl).
> 
> I think the intention was to allow other helm charts the ability to create thier own S3 users / buckets in a standardized way. Do we anticipate the need for charts to create their own placement targets? Or should this configuration be solely managed by the ceph-rgw chart?

I'll move the script to the local bin dir."}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2021-03-10 18:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32190, 'date': '2021-03-10 20:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 16:15:13.000000000', 'message': "Add support for rgw placement targets

This PS adds support for rgw placement targets

https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/placement/#placement-targets

This assumes the following items from the default openstack-helm
deployment are not changed:

rgw-zonegroup: default
rgw-zone: default
rgw index-pool: default.rgw.buckets.index
rgw data-extra-pool: default-rgw.buckets.non-ec

It wouldn't be very difficult to add support for alternate zonegroups,
zones, index-pools and data-extra-pools but there is no need for that
right now.

Change-Id: I6fc643994dcf2c15a04f07b8703968a76c009c18

commit_message:
Add support for rgw placement targets

This PS adds support for rgw placement targets:

https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/radosgw/placement/#placement-targets

Change-Id: I6fc643994dcf2c15a04f07b8703968a76c009c18

commit_message:
Enable fact bits for ceph execution

ceph-ansible still requires that all the facts be collected by default
and inject fact vars is enabled. We want to turn that off for tripleo,
but in the mean time we need to force it back on when in run ansible for
ceph.

Change-Id: I607c29c45148b57dee34741397cf7a16ced8ef78
Related-Bug: #1915761
Related-Bug: #1917621
(cherry picked from commit ff8d309e9560826c918081a337a10524e13f4013)

commit_message:
[L3] Delete DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings after no gw ports

This is the code behavior aligning for dvr related logical. The
L3 dvr DB will remove all related FIP agent gateway port after there
is no real use of it. But the DvrFipGatewayPortAgentBindings remain,
it will cause the issue of new floating IP failed to bind. This
patch adds the binding deleting action.

Related-bug: #1883089
Change-Id: I62c29e172bc8705dade11d37bb347241ef8ad5f8
(cherry picked from commit 8dee0d9a4eb4282b989f2c77a79e55aa89554788)

commit_message:
Close ring gz file after loading

The files will eventually be closed by the garbage collector but it's
good practice to close them immediately after use, and stops some unit
test runners displaying many resource warnings about unclosed files.

Change-Id: Ieba030e0988623bf44b1c7b164e4d29990333dc0

[{'created': '2021-02-23 13:40:55.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 15:17:00.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
(cherry picked from commit ff570d1b4e9b9777405ae75cc09eae2ce255bf19)
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
(cherry picked from commit ff570d1b4e9b9777405ae75cc09eae2ce255bf19)

commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Do not fail if ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" is not supported

Some NICs do not support ip-link vf "min_tx_rate" parameter. This is
not an API issue (ip-link or Pyroute2); the parameter is already
supported. The error is returned by the specific NIC driver.

A sanity check is implemented, reading the SR-IOV configured devices
("physical_device_mappings") and the excluded VFs ("exclude_devices").

Change-Id: If70de0a7112777ac4011ad42af0ac98969765011
Closes-Bug: #1918464

commit_message:
apidb: Compact Stein database migrations

Specific changes include:

- Add 'user_id' column to 'instance_mappings' table (062)
- Add index covering 'user_id' and 'project_id' columns to
  'instance_mappings' table (062)

Note that we forgot to add placeholder migrations in Rocky, meaning
there is significantly less to clean up here.

Change-Id: I38a6f4d1c3d2a9797ba543694401b7b821a79805
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable fact bits for ceph execution

ceph-ansible still requires that all the facts be collected by default
and inject fact vars is enabled. We want to turn that off for tripleo,
but in the mean time we need to force it back on when in run ansible for
ceph.

Change-Id: I607c29c45148b57dee34741397cf7a16ced8ef78
Related-Bug: #1915761
Related-Bug: #1917621
(cherry picked from commit ff8d309e9560826c918081a337a10524e13f4013)

commit_message:
Enable fact bits for ceph execution

ceph-ansible still requires that all the facts be collected by default
and inject fact vars is enabled. We want to turn that off for tripleo,
but in the mean time we need to force it back on when in run ansible for
ceph.

Change-Id: I607c29c45148b57dee34741397cf7a16ced8ef78
Related-Bug: #1915761
Related-Bug: #1917621
(cherry picked from commit ff8d309e9560826c918081a337a10524e13f4013)

commit_message:
Python version in tox.ini

Changed py38 to just py in tox.ini
so that it uses which ever python is locally installed
and doesnt fail if specifically python38 is not present

Lee, on IRC you said you have a local reproducer for the issue you saw on Ubuntu.  When you get a few minutes, do you mind posting it here?  Just so we don't duplicate efforts."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2020-04-21 09:11:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Looking at the five failures from here[*] in a little more detail, only one test is a legitimate failure related to Q35, because IDE (which is not supported for Q35) is used for CDROM in this test:

tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_rescue.ServerStableDeviceRescueTest --> test_stable_device_rescue_cdrom_ide()

I posted this crude WIP one-liner to that test (but that wouldn't work when the job is using 'pc', though): https://review.opendev.org/721555

Posting the five failures here and their reason, for posterity:

(1) tempest.api.compute.admin.test_volume_swap.TestVolumeSwap:

    tempest.lib.exceptions.TimeoutException: Request timed out
    Details: volume e51e3497-7db5-47f3-9efd-6365373ed132 failed to reach available status (current in-use) within the required time (196 s).


(2) tempest.api.compute.servers.test_device_tagging.TaggedBootDevicesTest:

    tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: Command 'set -eu -o pipefail; PATH=$PATH:/sbin:/usr/sbin; blkid -L config-2 -o device', exit status: 2, stderr:


(3) tempest.api.compute.servers.test_device_tagging.TaggedBootDevicesTest_v242:

    tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: Command 'set -eu -o pipefail; PATH=$PATH:/sbin:/usr/sbin; blkid -L config-2 -o device', exit status: 2, stderr:


(4) tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_rescue.ServerStableDeviceRescueTest --> test_stable_device_rescue_cdrom_ide[id-947004c3-e8ef-47d9-9f00-97b74f9eaf96]:

    tempest.exceptions.BuildErrorException: Server 3beee9aa-fb80-46db-ac07-e59252a8d9c3 failed to build and is in ERROR status
    Details: {'code': 400, 'created': '2020-04-20T15:27:32Z', 'message': 'Instance 3beee9aa-fb80-46db-ac07-e59252a8d9c3 cannot be rescued: Driver Error: unsupported configuration: IDE controllers are unsupported for this QEMU binary or machine type'}


(5) test_server_basic_ops[compute,id-7fff3fb3-91d8-4fd0-bd7d-0204f1f180ba,network,smoke]:

    tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: Command 'set -eu -o pipefail; PATH=$PATH:/sbin:/usr/sbin; blkid -L config-2 -o device', exit status: 2, stderr:


[*] https://a23b1dcd976a3689ccdb-24d23f95509aa29f3f112a150d6939cd.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/708701/4/check/nova-next/eae82fa/testr_results.html"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2020-04-21 09:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-04-21 10:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Looking at the five failures from here[*] in a little more detail,
 > only one test is a legitimate failure related to Q35, because IDE
 > (which is not supported for Q35) is used for CDROM in this test:

They all look legitimate IMHO.

 > tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_rescue.ServerStableDeviceRescueTest
 > --> test_stable_device_rescue_cdrom_ide()
 > 
 > I posted this crude WIP one-liner to that test (but that wouldn't
 > work when the job is using 'pc', though): https://review.opendev.org/721555
 > 
 > Posting the five failures here and their reason, for posterity:
 > 
 > (1) tempest.api.compute.admin.test_volume_swap.TestVolumeSwap:
 > 
 > tempest.lib.exceptions.TimeoutException: Request timed out
 > Details: volume e51e3497-7db5-47f3-9efd-6365373ed132 failed to
 > reach available status (current in-use) within the required time
 > (196 s).

This looks legit, the call to swap is failing as Libvirt is unable to find the target device in the domain.

I'll reproduce and confirm.

 > (2) tempest.api.compute.servers.test_device_tagging.TaggedBootDevicesTest:
 > 
 > tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: Command 'set -eu -o
 > pipefail; PATH=$PATH:/sbin:/usr/sbin; blkid -L config-2 -o device',

 > (5) test_server_basic_ops[compute,id-7fff3fb3-91d8-4fd0-bd7d-0204f1f180ba,network,smoke]:
 > 
 > tempest.lib.exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: Command 'set -eu -o
 > pipefail; PATH=$PATH:/sbin:/usr/sbin; blkid -L config-2 -o device',
 > exit status: 2, stderr:
 

FWIW I think each of these is valid, we can't find the config drive that's now using SATA when q35 is used.
 
 > (4) tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_rescue.ServerStableDeviceRescueTest
 > --> test_stable_device_rescue_cdrom_ide[id-947004c3-e8ef-47d9-9f00-97b74f9eaf96]:

 > failed to build and is in ERROR status
 > Details: {'code': 400, 'created': '2020-04-20T15:27:32Z',
 > 'message': 'Instance 3beee9aa-fb80-46db-ac07-e59252a8d9c3 cannot be
 > rescued: Driver Error: unsupported configuration: IDE controllers
 > are unsupported for this QEMU binary or machine type'}

Yup, still a valid test for the PC machine type but it isn't going to work here so as discussed we need a configurable to disable this."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-04-21 12:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/708701/5 : SUCCESS in 2h 30m 07s'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-04-21 13:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/nova on branch master.  The error was:

  The key "name" appears more than once; duplicate keys are not
  permitted.

The error appears in the following stanza:

  name: nova-ceph-multistore
      parent: devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3
      description: |
        Just like the normal ceph job, but with glance multistore
      irrelevant-files: *dsvm-irrelevant-files
      required-projects:
        - openstack/nova
      pre-run:
        - playbooks/ceph/glance-copy-policy.yaml
      vars:
        # NOTE(danms): These tests create an empty non-raw image, which nova
        # will refuse because we set never_download_image_if_on_rbd in this job.
        # Just skip these tests for this case.
        tempest_black_regex: .*encrypted_cinder_volumes.*
        devstack_localrc:
          GLANCE_STANDALONE: True
          GLANCE_USE_IMPORT_WORKFLOW: True
        devstack_local_conf:
          post-config:
            $NOVA_CONF:
              libvirt:
                images_rbd_glance_store_name: robust
              workarounds:
                never_download_image_if_on_rbd: True
            $GLANCE_API_CONF:
              DEFAULT:
                enabled_backends: "cheap:file, robust:rbd"
                default_log_levels: "amqp=WARN, amqplib=WARN, boto=WARN, qpid=WARN, sqlalchemy=WARN, suds=INFO, oslo.messaging=INFO, oslo_messaging=INFO, iso8601=WARN, requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool=WARN, urllib3.connectionpool=WARN, websocket=WARN, requests.packages.urllib3.util.retry=WARN, urllib3.util.retry=WARN, keystonemiddleware=WARN, routes.middleware=WARN, stevedore=WARN, taskflow=WARN, keystoneauth=WARN, oslo.cache=INFO, dogpile.core.dogpile=INFO, oslo_policy=DEBUG"
              glance_store:
                default_backend: cheap
                stores: file, http, rbd
                default_store: file
              robust:
                rbd_store_pool: images
                rbd_store_user: glance
                rbd_store_ceph_conf: /etc/ceph/ceph.conf
              cheap:
                filesystem_store_datadir: /opt/stack/data/glance/images/
              os_glance_staging_store:
                filesystem_store_datadir: /opt/stack/data/glance/os_glance_staging_store/
              os_glance_tasks_store:
                filesystem_store_datadir: /opt/stack/data/glance/os_glance_tasks_store/
            $GLANCE_IMAGE_IMPORT_CONF:
              image_import_opts:
                image_import_plugins: "['image_conversion']"
              image_conversion:
                output_format: raw
      name: devstack-platform-fedora-latest-virt-preview-q35
      parent: devstack-platform-fedora-latest-virt-preview
      description: WIP F32 Q35 test job
      irrelevant-files: *dsvm-irrelevant-files

            $NOVA_CPU_CONF:

                num_pcie_ports: 24
                hw_machine_type: "x86_64=q35"

"}, {'created': '2021-02-15 13:57:11.000000000', 'message': "WIP: nova-next: Start testing the 'q35' machine type

To allow this to pass at present the following changes are made from the
original job.

- [libvirt]num_pcie_ports is increased to 24

- [compute-feature-enabled]config_drive is disabled

This is required as when using the q35 machine type the libvirt driver
currently uses a SATA disk bus for any cdrom devices, such as a config
drive, attached to an instance.

At the time of writing this is not supported by Cirrosi 0.5.1 and
appears caused by some missing kernel modules, thus we disable the use
of config drive tests for now.

- [compute-feature-enabled]ide_bus is disabled

The q35 machine type does not support an IDE bus so any tests using this
bus are disabled.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/775630
Change-Id: Iad1adbc23b31dd54a96299e7a8a4b622c15eed8d
"}, {'created': '2021-03-04 09:36:56.000000000', 'message': "WIP: nova-next: Start testing the 'q35' machine type

To allow this to pass at present the following changes are made from the
original job.

- A custom build of Cirros 0.5.1 is used, enabling the ahci module

This is required as when using the q35 machine type the libvirt driver
currently uses a SATA disk bus for any cdrom devices, such as a config
drive, attached to an instance.

This was addressed in Cirros by the following change:

https://github.com/cirros-dev/cirros/pull/65

While we wait for an offical release a custom build has been cached in
our CI image by the following change:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/778590

- [libvirt]num_pcie_ports is increased to 24

- [compute-feature-enabled]ide_bus is disabled

bus are disabled.

commit_message:
nova-next: Start testing the q35 machine type

With the introduction of the libvirt-default-machine-type blueprint
operators are now able to change the default machine type used by an
existing environment more easily. This should hopefully allow more
deployments to switch to the modern q35 machine type, away from the
legacy pc machine type that is currently the default.

With this in mind this change aims to start testing the q35 machine type
as part of the nova-next job before we eventually change the default in
the future.

The following changes are made to the job to allow it to pass with q35:

- [libvirt]num_pcie_ports is increased to 24

This is required as more devices are now connected by default over PCIe.

- [compute-feature-enabled]ide_bus is disabled

The q35 machine type does not support an IDE bus so any tests using this
bus are now skipped.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/779179
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/775630
blueprint: libvirt-default-machine-type
Change-Id: Iad1adbc23b31dd54a96299e7a8a4b622c15eed8d

[{'created': '2021-02-15 13:46:38.000000000', 'message': "compute: Add [compute-feature-enabled]ide_bus flag

This change adds a specific flag to allow environments to indicate that
they do not support an IDE bus being used to attach devices to an
instance.

This is required as Nova's libvirt driver is looking to default to the
newer QEMU machine types such as ``q35`` in the future [1]. These newer
machine types have dropped support for the IDE bus in favour of the more
modern SATA, SCSI and VirtIO buses. As such in the longer term it cannot
be assumed that the IDE bus will always be available and in the short
term we need a way to indicate that an environment doesn't support IDE
when it's using the ``q35`` machine type.

For now the flag defaults to True but will need to move to False if Nova
ever defaults to the ``q35`` machine type.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/libvirt-stash-instance-machine-type.html

Change-Id: I40824fc3c88f16050407e52a790dd162f1f67e3a

commit_message:
compute: Add [compute-feature-enabled]ide_bus flag

This change adds a specific flag to allow environments to indicate that
they do not support an IDE bus being used to attach devices to an
instance.

This is required as Nova's libvirt driver is looking to default to the
newer QEMU machine types such as ``q35`` in the future [1]. These newer
machine types have dropped support for the IDE bus in favour of the more
modern SATA, SCSI and VirtIO buses. As such in the longer term it cannot
be assumed that the IDE bus will always be available and in the short
term we need a way to indicate that an environment doesn't support IDE
when it's using the ``q35`` machine type.

For now the flag defaults to True but will need to move to False if Nova
ever defaults to the ``q35`` machine type.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/libvirt-stash-instance-machine-type.html

Change-Id: I40824fc3c88f16050407e52a790dd162f1f67e3a

commit_message:
s3api: Pass through CORS headers

This adds support for presigned GET URLs, at least.

Note that there is no support yet for preflight requests, so a whole
bunch of other CORS stuff *doesn't* work (yet). This was just an easy
first step.

Change-Id: I43150a630a2a7620099e6bfecaed3bbe958ba423

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I833d797cdc14fc360575d7df5026b51e96c367ef

[{'created': '2021-01-18 16:14:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OVN provider jobs

The name of the OVN provider job template changed from
ovn-octavia-provider-v2-dsvm-scenario to
ovn-octavia-provider-tempest-release but was not updated
here, fix it so those non-voting jobs will run.

Change-Id: I3159adeae2456c8fecad87bbfb0f526363e7752b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OVN provider jobs

The name of the OVN provider job template changed from
ovn-octavia-provider-v2-dsvm-scenario to
ovn-octavia-provider-tempest-release but was not updated
here, fix it so those non-voting jobs will run.

Change-Id: I3159adeae2456c8fecad87bbfb0f526363e7752b

Hi Maysa, like this?'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, it was like this. However, we might still hit the issue because it seems OVN is being build from OSapackaged version meaning that the ovn changes won't have any affect. This commit indicates that https://github.com/openstack/devstack/commit/e651d9ef8840bb7dd497b557125ce1cd5290993d note that the OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE is default to False, perhaps we change that variable on the OVN jobs configuration to see if it helps. Also, the VAR_RUN_PATH on the ovn jobs would likely need to change to "/usr/local/var/run"'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And for the gates that will test with Amphora, it also likely not work because if I saw correctly there was changes on the Amphora on the Octavia patch. The CI gets one specific pre-build image 
https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/.zuul.d/octavia.yaml#L23.

We can see if it works on the CI with ovn first and then we analyze the Amphora case.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-10 14:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'd rather see the kuryr-tempest-plugin patch green before merging this."}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 14:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Makes sense, thanks. Plus, this patch is building OVN from source and I want to also allow it build Octavia from source for the Amphora driver dependency so I can be sure the kuryr-tempest-plugin passes all the tests. 

P.S. I'm still trying to figure out how to build Octavia from source"}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 15:00:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 
> P.S. I'm still trying to figure out how to build Octavia from source

So merging would probably be after the ovn-octavia-provider and/or the octavia-amphora patches are merged, right?"}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 15:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2021-02-12 15:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Let's see how it'll work now!"}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2021-02-15 10:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-02-15 16:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-02-15 21:52:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I agree it is more risky like this... but on the plus side we will more easily detect when something breaks us from there. I have no strong opinion to go either way"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-02-16 10:40:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> 
> [1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/playbooks/get_amphora_tarball.yaml#L5

This amphora image tarball is built daily, check out dates at [1]. Last build happened this morning -  2021-02-18 06:08 and the patch was merged yesterday so we should be good to stop building it.

commit_message:
Change RBAC for share group snapshots

Allow project administrators to force
delete and reset status on share group
snapshots by default since that delegation
may be desirable in the cloud and it
does not violate tenancy.

Change-Id: Ib9b9b306be9073c4cea9b2d190d3325f29c7bd3f
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add documentation on the usage of keystone's scope & roles

As Tempest support the keystone's scope and new default roles
like reader, this commit document that how those can be
requested and used in Tempest or its plugins tests.

Change-Id: Iebacbeda231f82d6d16dbdcde635f19ae862181f

commit_message:
relinker: continue cleaning up old files despite failure

If the relinker cleanup fails to remove one file in an old partition
hash dir then it will now continue to attempt to remove other files in
the same hash dir.

Also, adds and improves unit tests for relinker cleanup.

Change-Id: I0f537209bce87a0b7a78b33813b694a6b697104a

commit_message:
relinker: make cleanup checks more robust

Before removing object files from the old partition ensure that all
required links exist in the new partition.  Allow for the object files
in the old partition to not necessarily be among the required files
if, for example, newer files have been created in the new partition
since relinking occurred.

When required links do not already exist in the new partition an
attempt is made to create them during cleanup.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6e01ed29eb8971eeff96887efbfdfb76a01b00c3

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib97b1a455f58cf66c39020960f28733b323e3563

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: If3b3fef1a8b7a86db1bf08fa3cd05457209d3fa0

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: glance-wallaby'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:19:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-10 19:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck devstack changed'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-11 19:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So, based on the conversation on the list, one way to change this is to make tempest use the admin client for the metadef stuff such that it will continue to work with admin-only creation policy, if that's what we decide to do."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

yeah as this is only policy permission change we do not need to test both old and new policy in Tempest. Tempest can just test the latest default working policies. To do that you can do:

- all these tests can be inherited from BaseV2ImageAdminTest
- Move those test file under admin dir https://github.com/openstack/tempest/tree/master/tempest/api/image/v2/admin
- defined all client in BaseV2ImageAdminTest what all these test needed, like -https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/143abec5c5ab30ed94109f870f93e781306f3c1b/tempest/api/image/base.py#L206'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

also these API(tests) are not used in interop (https://opendev.org/osf/interop/src/branch/master/next.json) so we are good here to move the test permission to admin.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> - all these tests can be inherited from BaseV2ImageAdminTest
> - Move those test file under admin dir https://github.com/openstack/tempest/tree/master/tempest/api/image/v2/admin
> - defined all client in BaseV2ImageAdminTest what all these test needed, like -https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/143abec5c5ab30ed94109f870f93e781306f3c1b/tempest/api/image/base.py#L206

Ack, I will try to get something to do that stacked on top here to show the option. Thanks Gmann!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-12 21:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make image metadef tests optional

Starting in Wallaby, Glance has disabled these APIs by default in
policy, and requires operators to opt-in to them if they want them
enabled and accept the risk of doing so. This adds a boolean config
toggle to tell tempest whether or not it should try to test those
APIs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/779808
Change-Id: I96fdfdcff9e86a8088420fe9ce0f299f2b5683b4
Related-Bug: #1916926

this is not needed as discussed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/779814'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:29:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> this is not needed as discussed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/779814

Note that it's not needed only if we go the admin-only-for-create route. There are other issues with this API besides just unbounded create, so I'll leave this open in case we decide to keep the stricter approach. But yes, if we do the admin thing, then this goes away."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > this is not needed as discussed in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/779814
> 
> Note that it's not needed only if we go the admin-only-for-create route. There are other issues with this API besides just unbounded create, so I'll leave this open in case we decide to keep the stricter approach. But yes, if we do the admin thing, then this goes away.

ack."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-12 21:42:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make lib/glance re-enable metadef policy

Starting in Wallaby Glance will disable the metadef APIs in policy
by default in order to mitigate the related bug. This makes devstack
re-enable those (as an operator may opt to do) so that the tempest
tests we have for them will run.

Related-Bug: #1916926
Change-Id: Id141945d9bff54b25c010c0331473b894dd05848

commit_message:
Allow users to configure priority for {create,delete}_configuration

At the moment, users do not have a way to easily prioritize those
cleaning steps into automatic cleaning.  This patch allows the user
to enable those options and prioritize them as needed for automatic
cleaning.

Change-Id: I3b647e39982c0a98abac7b0a7c1c60215d6db4f2

commit_message:
replace the "hide_hypervisor_id" to "hw:hide_hypervisor_id"

When we use the flavor extra_specs "hide_hypervisor_id" in
AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, then will retrun False.
So we need correct the extra_specs.

NOTE: The first two files do not exist in stable/train due to
extra specs validators (patch Ib64a1348cce1dca995746214616c4f33d9d664bd)
was introduced in Ussuri.
The last one file has conflict due to the same
bp/flavor-extra-sepc-validators feature
(patch: I8da84b48e4d630eeb91d92346aa2323e25e28e3b)
added in Ussuri.

Conflicts:
	nova/api/validation/extra_specs/hw.py
	nova/api/validation/extra_specs/null.py
	nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavors_extra_specs.py

Change-Id: I9d8d8c3a30cf6da7e8fb48374347e069ab075df2
Closes-Bug: 1841932
(cherry picked from commit bf488a8630702160021b5848bf6e86fbb8015205)
(cherry picked from commit 9d28d7ec808469ec129b66c69b9e63cd9537a63f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-03 18:09:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix os.stat/os.link race in diskfile.relink_paths

Previously, when a diskfile was relinked by the relinker, the
diskfile.relink_paths() would test for the existence of the link
before attempting to create it. This 'test then set' might race with
another process creating the same diskfile (e.g. a concurrent PUT
which created the very same object in an old partition that the
relinker is now relinking). The race might lead to an attempt to
create a link that already exists (despite the pre-check) and an
EEXIST exception being raised.

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the
EEXIST exception is still raised.

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3
"}, {'created': '2021-03-04 17:37:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix os.link exceptions in diskfile.relink_paths

Previously, when a diskfile was relinked in a new partition, the
diskfile.relink_paths() would test for the existence of the link
before attempting to create it. This 'test then set' might race with
another process creating the same diskfile (e.g. a concurrent PUT
which created the very same object in an old partition that the
relinker is also relinking). The race might lead to an attempt to
create a link that already exists (despite the pre-check) and an
EEXIST exception being raised.

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the
EEXIST exception is still raised.

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

relink_paths() might also raise an ENOENT exception if, while a
diskfile is being relinked in the 'new' partition dir, another process
PUTs a newer version of the same object and as a result cleans up the
older diskfile in the 'old' partition before the first process has
called os.link().

This patch modifies relink_paths() to tolerate ENOENT exceptions from
os.link() but only if the target path (i.e. the file in the 'old'
partition) no longer exists. Otherwise the ENOENT will still be
raised.

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3
"}, {'created': '2021-03-05 06:01:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix os.link exceptions in diskfile.relink_paths

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

PUTs a newer version of the same object and as a result cleans up the
older diskfile in the 'old' partition before the first process has
called os.link().

This patch modifies relink_paths() to tolerate ENOENT exceptions from
os.link() but only if the target path (i.e. the file in the 'old'
partition) no longer exists. Otherwise the ENOENT will still be
raised.

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3
"}, {'created': '2021-03-11 17:19:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix os.link exceptions in diskfile.relink_paths

Previously, when a diskfile was relinked in a new partition, the
diskfile.relink_paths() would test for the existence of the link
before attempting to create it. This 'test then set' might race with
another process creating the same diskfile (e.g. a concurrent PUT
which created the very same object in an old partition that the
relinker is also relinking). The race might lead to an attempt to
create a link that already exists (despite the pre-check) and an
EEXIST exception being raised.

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the
EEXIST exception is still raised.

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

relink_paths() might also raise an ENOENT exception if, while a
diskfile is being relinked in the 'new' partition dir, another process
PUTs a newer version of the same object and as a result cleans up the
older diskfile in the 'old' partition before the first process has
called os.link().

This patch modifies relink_paths() to tolerate ENOENT exceptions from
os.link() but only if the target path (i.e. the file in the 'old'
partition) no longer exists. Otherwise the ENOENT will still be
raised.

This patch also modifies relink_paths() to return a boolean indicating
if the hard link was created by the call to the method (True) or not
(False).

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3
"}, {'created': '2021-03-12 15:25:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix os.link exceptions in diskfile.relink_paths

Previously, when a diskfile was relinked in a new partition, the
diskfile.relink_paths() would test for the existence of the link
before attempting to create it. This 'test then set' might race with
another process creating the same diskfile (e.g. a concurrent PUT
which created the very same object in an old partition that the
relinker is also relinking). The race might lead to an attempt to
create a link that already exists (despite the pre-check) and an
EEXIST exception being raised.

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the
EEXIST exception is still raised.

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

relink_paths() might also raise an ENOENT exception if, while a
diskfile is being relinked in the 'new' partition dir, another process
PUTs a newer version of the same object and as a result cleans up the
older diskfile in the 'old' partition before the first process has
called os.link().

This patch modifies relink_paths() to tolerate ENOENT exceptions from
os.link() but only if the target path (i.e. the file in the 'old'
partition) no longer exists. Otherwise the ENOENT will still be
raised.

This patch also modifies relink_paths() to return a boolean indicating
if the hard link was created by the call to the method (True) or not
(False).

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix os.link exceptions in diskfile.relink_paths

Previously, when a diskfile was relinked in a new partition, the
diskfile.relink_paths() would test for the existence of the link
before attempting to create it. This 'test then set' might race with
another process creating the same diskfile (e.g. a concurrent PUT
which created the very same object in an old partition that the
relinker is also relinking). The race might lead to an attempt to
create a link that already exists (despite the pre-check) and an
EEXIST exception being raised.

This patch modifies relink_paths to tolerate EEXIST exceptions but
only if the existing file is a link to the target file. Otherwise the
EEXIST exception is still raised.

The 'check_existing' argument for relink_paths is removed since it is
no longer relevant.

relink_paths() might also raise an ENOENT exception if, while a
diskfile is being relinked in the 'new' partition dir, another process
PUTs a newer version of the same object and as a result cleans up the
older diskfile in the 'old' partition before the first process has
called os.link().

This patch modifies relink_paths() to tolerate ENOENT exceptions from
os.link() but only if the target path (i.e. the file in the 'old'
partition) no longer exists. Otherwise the ENOENT will still be
raised.

This patch also modifies relink_paths() to return a boolean indicating
if the hard link was created by the call to the method (True) or not
(False).

Closes-Bug: 1917658
Change-Id: I65d4b83c56699ed566fbfb7068f9d2681ca67aa3

commit_message:
Move neutron pip packages from constraints to requirements

This is necessary to support the new pip resolver.

Depends-On: I9be6bbf4a29a4da2ddf96dc0336bc2a7d8ec9281

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (at this moment train) are removed.

Remove lower-constraints job.
Also adds a backport with the fix for paramiko.
Pin tempest to version 23.0.0 in Python 2.7 job.

Disable long time broken multinode job (also disabled in ironic).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774913

Co-Authored-By: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>

Change-Id: Ia22412770d1af0af0356f6779ccaa07b86a10898
(cherry picked from commit 2411ff78e1e0cc7f7e654d3cec64b16de7f9c1ac)

subject: Fix using sha1 as git ref with RECLONE
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-12 18:20:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix using sha1 as git ref with RECLONE

git_clone doesn't work when using at the same time RECLONE and a sha1 as
git ref.
Some projects such as neutron are cloning the OVS repo using a
particular commit. This commit allows to check out a sha1 on RECLONE.

Change-Id: I1d5a0cfad05da99c119b3067c7da4826e3766d02
"}]
commit_message:
Fix using sha1 as git ref with RECLONE

git_clone doesn't work when using at the same time RECLONE and a sha1 as
git ref.
Some projects such as neutron are cloning the OVS repo using a
particular commit. This commit allows to check out a sha1 on RECLONE.

Change-Id: I1d5a0cfad05da99c119b3067c7da4826e3766d02

This looks pretty good. I've got some small nits inline but you could ignore those. The -1 is for the missing 'RateLimit' definition. I'd be okay with doing that separately normally, but as this is your first patch I think it makes sense to fix that now?"}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-02-24 07:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-02-24 09:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Much better. One subresource still missing though. It would be helpful if you left replies on the previous comments just to say whether you addressed them too, btw. There's a "Done" button which will mark the comment as resolved, or you can leave another comment if you e.g. disagree with something'}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-02-25 06:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(12 comments)

Thanks for the feedback. Sorry the my replies to your comments didn't go through, I didn't know that they were drafts and that I had to send them. I finished the style changes and I added the final attributes by adding the "RateLimit" object in limit.py. I also changed what was previously known as "RateLimit" to "RateLimits". I believe limit.py should be good now, however, I don't know if my test file is up to par. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-02-25 07:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-02-25 13:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I will make sure to keep your feedback in mind in the future.'}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-02-25 15:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2021-02-25 16:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Change has been implemented. Thanks for the suggestion!'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-03-01 16:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-03-02 09:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(4 comments)

Thanks for the constructive feedback, I believe many things are finally starting to click!

One big thing is that I changed the name of "limit.py" and "test_limit.py" to "limits.py" and "test_limits.py." After looking at the some of the documentation, it makes sense to me. First, the API lists the resource in parenthesis as "limits" where as before I thought it said "limit". Secondly, the compute component calls it's implementation as "limits.py".
On the same note, I changed the "resource_key = '"limit"' to "resource_key = '"limits"'.'}, {'account_id': 33032, 'date': '2021-03-02 09:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 32594, 'date': '2021-03-02 18:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-03-03 10:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-06 16:43:47.000000000', 'message': "Fix incorrect ERROR status with IPv6 UDP members

Some IPv6 UDP members were incorrectly marked in ERROR status because of
a formatting issue between the keepalived configuration file and the
ipvsadm output. Both are used to compute the state of the members and
when a member's address contained '*:0:*', parsing was incorrect. Now
the health message generation function uses only the compressed IPv6
notation instead of mixing notations.

Story: 2008604
Task: 41783

Change-Id: I2fe94cd4c000f143c59c69e82d03c690acf5e0c3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect ERROR status with IPv6 UDP members

Some IPv6 UDP members were incorrectly marked in ERROR status because of
a formatting issue between the keepalived configuration file and the
ipvsadm output. Both are used to compute the state of the members and
when a member's address contained '*:0:*', parsing was incorrect. Now
the health message generation function uses only the compressed IPv6
notation instead of mixing notations.

Story: 2008604
Task: 41783

Change-Id: I2fe94cd4c000f143c59c69e82d03c690acf5e0c3

Victoria only supports focal, so the upgrade from victoria
(starting from victoria+1) should use focal.

This patch should not be backported to victoria, because the
upgrades from ussuri still need to use bionic.

In order to make it work on focal:
- do not fail if ebtables does not contain the broute table
  (which happens when it is based on nft);
- when the swift loopback image is remounted on upgrade,
  do not use the nobarrier option, which was removed
  with the 4.19 kernel. See also the corresponding change
  in devstack: I6871a7765e3e04122d8d546f43d36bb8415383fc

Change-Id: If57c54828baf4e250ad08fdd95351490010e1b41
'}]
commit_message:
Switch the grenade job to focal

Victoria only supports focal, so the upgrade from victoria
(starting from victoria+1) should use focal.

This patch should not be backported to victoria, because the
upgrades from ussuri still need to use bionic.

In order to make it work on focal:
- do not fail if ebtables does not contain the broute table
  (which happens when it is based on nft);
- when the swift loopback image is remounted on upgrade,
  do not use the nobarrier option, which was removed
  with the 4.19 kernel. See also the corresponding change
  in devstack: I6871a7765e3e04122d8d546f43d36bb8415383fc

Change-Id: If57c54828baf4e250ad08fdd95351490010e1b41

commit_message:
Remove nautilus repo to pull ceph packages from promotion jobs

ceph-ansible is available in the octopus repo, and it can be used
as the default source to pull all the Ceph related packages.

Closes-Bug: #1918672
Change-Id: If16ee0b9ad63f6764f0b15d847e57840b5f6b19b

commit_message:
Explicitly use python3 for python scripts

Focal images do not provide 'python' anymore,
and this  means that those scripts are broken
in that environment without this change.

And make sure the scripts are really py3 compatible
(fix a buffering issue)

Change-Id: I652e5d007d5a606f0fe89ac6b3ea76f765be1ae4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-02 17:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. The 'instance_uuid'
column in the pci_devices table is used to track the allocation
association of a PCI with an instance. There is a small time window
during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
(cherry picked from commit 1c256cf774693e2395ae8fe4a7a2f416a7aeb03a)
(cherry picked from commit 09784db62fcd01124a101c4c69cab6e71e1ac781)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent archiving of pci_devices records because of 'instance_uuid'

Currently in the archive_deleted_rows code, we will attempt to clean up
"residue" of deleted instance records by assuming any table with a
'instance_uuid' column represents data tied to an instance's lifecycle
and delete such records.

This behavior poses a problem in the case where an instance has a PCI
device allocated and someone deletes the instance. The 'instance_uuid'
column in the pci_devices table is used to track the allocation
association of a PCI with an instance. There is a small time window
during which the instance record has been deleted but the PCI device
has not yet been freed from a database record perspective as PCI
devices are freed during the _complete_deletion method in the compute
manager as part of the resource tracker update call.

Records in the pci_devices table are anyway not related to the
lifecycle of instances so they should not be considered residue to
clean up if an instance is deleted. This adds a condition to avoid
archiving pci_devices on the basis of an instance association.

Closes-Bug: #1899541

Change-Id: Ie62d3566230aa3e2786d129adbb2e3570b06e4c6
(cherry picked from commit 1c256cf774693e2395ae8fe4a7a2f416a7aeb03a)
(cherry picked from commit 09784db62fcd01124a101c4c69cab6e71e1ac781)

commit_message:
Generate certificates using ansible role

This is using linux-system-roles.certificate ansible role,
which replaces puppet-certmonger for submitting certificate
requests to certmonger. Each service is configured through
it's heat template.

Partial-Implements: blueprint ansible-certmonger
Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/31713
Change-Id: Ib868465c20d97c62cbcb214bfc62d949bd6efc62

commit_message:
Start running the tempest API tests

We were previously only running the scenario tests.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/+/742644

commit_message:
Deploy RGW, MDS, Ganesha and Ceph Dashboard using cephadm

This change adds the mkspec module which is able to build
a daemon specific spec and apply it against the deployed
Ceph cluster.
In addition, multiple tasks have been added with the purpose
of integrating all the scenario004 services and properly
manage the cephadm playbook flow according to the enabled
services.

Change-Id: I35e57abddc64310a6422174fe191bd328588d7cd

commit_message:
yaql: add patch to drop unittest2 dependency

in SUSE the implicit unittest2 dependency of python was patched
out to prepare for python 3.9, so we need to remove its uses
via a patch

Change-Id: Ida3381f4715cf28d403fe683b63188aa09fa0608

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Disable autoscaling before pools are created

When autoscaling is disabled after pools are created, there is an
opportunity for some autoscaling to take place before autoscaling
is disabled. This change checks to see if autoscaling needs to be
disabled before creating pools, then checks to see if it needs to
be enabled after creating pools. This ensures that autoscaling
won't happen when autoscaler is disabled and autoscaling won't
start prematurely as pools are being created when it is enabled.

Change-Id: I8803b799b51735ecd3a4878d62be45ec50bbbe19

      state: active    upper: ''

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-09 04:41:37.000000000', 'message': "Add a config file option to swift-manage-shard-ranges

While working on the shrinking recon drops, we want to display numbers
that directly relate to how tool should behave. But currently all
options of the s-m-s-r tool is driven by cli options.

This creates a disconnect, defining what should be used in the sharder
and in the tool via options are bound for failure. It would be much
better to be able to define the required default options for your
environment in one place that both the sharder and tool could use.

This patch does some refactoring and adding max_shrinking and
max_expanding options to the sharding config. As well as adds a
--config option to the tool.

The --config option expects a config with at '[container-sharder]'
section. It only supports the shard options:
 - max_shrinking
 - max_expanding
 - shard_container_threshold
 - shard_shrink_point

The latter 2 are used to generate the s-m-s-r's:
 - shrink_threshold
 - expansion_limit
 - rows_per_shard

Use of cli arguments take precedence over that of the config.

Change-Id: I4d0147ce284a1a318b3cd88975e060956d186aec
