commit_message:
Add a config file option to swift-manage-shard-ranges

While working on the shrinking recon drops, we want to display numbers
that directly relate to how tool should behave. But currently all
options of the s-m-s-r tool is driven by cli options.

This creates a disconnect, defining what should be used in the sharder
and in the tool via options are bound for failure. It would be much
better to be able to define the required default options for your
environment in one place that both the sharder and tool could use.

This patch does some refactoring and adding max_shrinking and
max_expanding options to the sharding config. As well as adds a
--config option to the tool.

The --config option expects a config with at '[container-sharder]'
section. It only supports the shard options:
 - max_shrinking
 - max_expanding
 - shard_container_threshold
 - shard_shrink_point
 - shard_merge_point

The latter 2 are used to generate the s-m-s-r's:
 - shrink_threshold
 - expansion_limit
 - rows_per_shard

Use of cli arguments take precedence over that of the config.

Change-Id: I4d0147ce284a1a318b3cd88975e060956d186aec

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 10:34:36.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b04d64b90f2822222f96ddd726d379a2f19b539e)

commit_message:
Add support to use an alternative pypi index

This change intended to add support to build wheels in the air-gapped
environments where there is no access to the pypi.python.org and own
index should be used.

We can't simple provide the extra options in the venv_pip_install_args or
venv_pip_build_args variables because we also need to create the
~/.pydistutils.cfg with index for easy_install support.

This change do the same as Ib7d2a9aee9b13f38b73136f22f0b51e766c8dd10

Change-Id: Ib96fffd827503754dbd6a7c0763943000e77d208
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add the option to choose the Ironic endpoint type

This change adds the ability to choose another type of the Ironic endpoint
instead of default public one. It also deprecate 'os_region' option in favor
of standard 'region_name' option.

Change-Id: Id253cef2ecb97848179624b44318f7918496a5fc
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-24 14:07:28.000000000', 'message': 'Use standard env variables for the AIO bootstrap

This change apply custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE, PIP_OPTS and GET_PIP_URL settings
for AIO.

Also we bring the two new environment variables INDEX_URL and
TRUSTED_HOST to override default PyPi index repos. The AIO bootstrap
use these variables to update/build PIP_OPTS vairable.

Change-Id: Ic051173eb4d493c9201d9580becf8bab5ac18b45
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 10:44:53.000000000', 'message': "Add an ability to use custom PyPi index for deploy

This change adds an ability to use any external custom PyPi index
in the air-gapped environments to deploy OSA.

There are added three new environment variables - PIP_PYPI_MIRROR,
PIP_WHEEL_MIRROR and PIP_MIRROR_HOST to override default PyPi index
repos. The 'bootstrap-ansible.sh' and 'bootstrap-aio.sh' leverages
these variables to build/update the PIP_OPTS variable and also
creates '~/.pydistutils.cfg' file only if set and not empty.
The '~/.pydistutils.cfg' created from scratch with the settings
described in the Ie4ce336174aa2a825d125f7e0d9a256de139908b.

This is the second part of the changes which adds an ability to
deploy OAS in the air-gapped environments. The first one introduced
in the Iba750f6c91e7ca15267b728761ef41ecc4bf165f.

Change-Id: Ic051173eb4d493c9201d9580becf8bab5ac18b45
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add an ability to use custom PyPi index for deploy

This change adds an ability to use any external custom PyPi index
in the air-gapped environments to deploy OSA.

There are added three new environment variables - PIP_PYPI_MIRROR,
PIP_WHEEL_MIRROR and PIP_MIRROR_HOST to override default PyPi index
repos. The 'bootstrap-ansible.sh' and 'bootstrap-aio.sh' leverages
these variables to build/update the PIP_OPTS variable and also
creates '~/.pydistutils.cfg' file only if set and not empty.
The '~/.pydistutils.cfg' created from scratch with the settings
described in the Ie4ce336174aa2a825d125f7e0d9a256de139908b.

This is the second part of the changes which adds an ability to
deploy OAS in the air-gapped environments. The first one introduced
in the Iba750f6c91e7ca15267b728761ef41ecc4bf165f.

Change-Id: Ic051173eb4d493c9201d9580becf8bab5ac18b45
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Leverage the environment variables for the deploy

This change applies custom overrides set via environment settings to
leverage UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE and GET_PIP_URL already used in the
bootstrap-ansible.sh script. This will add an ability to deploy OSA
in the air-gapped environments because of hardcoded URLs pointed to
the git.openstack.org and bootstrap.pypa.io.

Change-Id: Iba750f6c91e7ca15267b728761ef41ecc4bf165f
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 19:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)

commit_message:
Update sample local.conf to mention OVN_BRANCH

Using OVN from packages was introduced in devstack via
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/763402

This change updates the sample file to make users aware of it,
the gate jobs already use it.

Change-Id: Ia778f86bcbdf71bb5bfd98c54417e81b72db6890

changed since ONTAP 8.3.

- Fixes access rules authentication methods for NFS when a
share server is configured for Kerberos.

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix kerberos security service issues

- Fixes the zapi calls for setting up a kerberos, which have
changed since ONTAP 8.3.
- Fixes kerberos configuration cleanup when deleting a
share server.
- Fixes access rules authentication methods for NFS when a
share server is configured for Kerberos.

Change-Id: I60b4f92979045b1fdb90ad8df4f65c1dfe463ae8
Closes-Bug: #1901189
Closes-Bug: #1904746
Closes-Bug: #1907669
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Rodrigues <felipefuty01@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add get PXE port MACs for BIOS mode

This change adds the ability to retrieve the list of PXE-enabled device
MAC addresses for legacy BIOS boot mode.

Change-Id: I4bf42bde631c5b41710ff1faead0477063e89971

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 21:06:50.000000000', 'message': "Pass context objects directly to policy enforcement

The oslo.policy Enforcer object understand what to do with instances of
oslo.context.RequestContext. This makes it easier to invoke enforcement
because we don't need to translate the context object to policy values
before we pass it into the policy engine, oslo.policy will do that for
us.

Change-Id: I08348503c092dc5665a0d81d01a2ef164ba7209e
"}]
commit_message:
Pass context objects directly to policy enforcement

The oslo.policy Enforcer object understand what to do with instances of
oslo.context.RequestContext. This makes it easier to invoke enforcement
because we don't need to translate the context object to policy values
before we pass it into the policy engine, oslo.policy will do that for
us.

Change-Id: I08348503c092dc5665a0d81d01a2ef164ba7209e

subject: Add CentOS 8 Stream jobs to puppet-openstack
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-03-12 14:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-03-12 15:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 14:38:45.000000000', 'message': "Add CentOS 8 Stream jobs to puppet-openstack

RDO has switched to use centos-8-stream to build and validate spec
changes in RDO Trunk for master. Also, now puppet-promotion pipeline is
using both CentOS Linux 8 and CentOS Stream 8 as promotion criteria.

This patch is adding CentOS 8 stream jobs in puppet-openstack projects.
First, i'm adding them to check pipelines as non-voting and once we
check they are stable we can move them to voting.

Change-Id: I6d5c26585a5f5687584a63435ce5cebba7ffae79
(cherry picked from commit acb80f48a2e7542d84423329f8deb04e8c223fcb)
"}]
commit_message:
Add CentOS 8 Stream jobs to puppet-openstack

RDO has switched to use centos-8-stream to build and validate spec
changes in RDO Trunk for master. Also, now puppet-promotion pipeline is
using both CentOS Linux 8 and CentOS Stream 8 as promotion criteria.

This patch is adding CentOS 8 stream jobs in puppet-openstack projects.
First, i'm adding them to check pipelines as non-voting and once we
check they are stable we can move them to voting.

Change-Id: I6d5c26585a5f5687584a63435ce5cebba7ffae79
(cherry picked from commit acb80f48a2e7542d84423329f8deb04e8c223fcb)

Expose [workaround]/ensure_libvirt_rbd_instance_dir_cleanup

This exposes the nova workaround to remove the instance directory on
clean up when using rbd.

> Patch Set 6:

> > Patch Set 6:
>  > 
>  > Hi Lee! I'm taking a look. This change merged one week ago, and I saw you saw this issue yesterday. Is that correct? Yesterday we had another changed merged, maybe that one might be causing the issue. Check this one https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/778981
> 
> I'm probably biased :) but that one only changes the branch-specific jobs used by this plugin

Then probably not, I'm just trying to find out what might be causing the issue"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-12 17:11:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Patch Set 6:
> 
> > Patch Set 6:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 6:
> >  > 
> >  > Hi Lee! I'm taking a look. This change merged one week ago, and I saw you saw this issue yesterday. Is that correct? Yesterday we had another changed merged, maybe that one might be causing the issue. Check this one https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/+/778981
> > 
> > I'm probably biased :) but that one only changes the branch-specific jobs used by this plugin
> 
> Then probably not, I'm just trying to find out what might be causing the issue

It was definitely this change that borked things by moving the default release but to be clear this isn't your fault at all.

Nova was abusing this plugin by checking it out directly and only running parts of it so you had no way of knowing without running these specific <=stable/train jobs from Nova.

The following series is pinning these jobs back to nautilus:

https://review.opendev.org/q/I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5

I'm also trying to follow up in master and remove the hooks responsible for this:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/778885

Once that's done I'll create fresh jobs for ceph using base jobs from this repo so this never happens again, hopefully."}]

commit_message:
Update ceph default version to octopus

Consume packages from download.ceph.com for ceph octopus
Our focal fossa based CI jobs are getting octopus from
ubuntu ppas instead of getting the packages from
download.ceph.com.

This happens because, even though we were defaulting to
nautilus, ubuntu got the later version available
(in this case, the packages in ubuntu ppas).

Also, remove CEPH_STABLE_RELEASE env var, unify to CEPH_RELEASE
Stable branches CI versioning is done in the jobs definition now

Change-Id: I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d

commit_message:
Release final python-ironicclient for Wallaby

This proposed a release for python-ironicclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Wallaby going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, March 11.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.6.0..59ffddd
f8af1df Add tests for 'baremetal port create' command

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id3967320bff1f37f4705228359d8bf85b26db080

Update requirements for wallaby release

Updates requirements to what we're using now and revises the
lower-constraints file to contain only direct dependencies.

commit_message:
Fix Remove revoked ceph apt-keys

when running the playbook it does appens that the apt_key task fails.
let's retry in case of failure to mimic the apt-key add that runs later.

Change-Id: Ie745496f515af1461bb8d03ba6b5c7cac5e71150
(cherry picked from commit 8948abae9a1a68d3fb1e2537390b6f52bae48cd6)

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Change-Id: I746e9c3246a257ca57c56b63c25a3cf9fcc49c9a

commit_message:
Fix Remove revoked ceph apt-keys

when running the playbook it does appens that the apt_key task fails.
let's retry in case of failure to mimic the apt-key add that runs later.

Change-Id: Ie745496f515af1461bb8d03ba6b5c7cac5e71150
(cherry picked from commit 8948abae9a1a68d3fb1e2537390b6f52bae48cd6)

commit_message:
Fix the error raised when password is not set

Currently, if the aodh::service_credentials::password parameter is not
set then the following error is raised.

pick(): must receive at least one non empty value

This change replaces the default so that we set the intended error
instead.

Change-Id: Ia63c6e752a75d8acbcc3a2fc3b34c6ace65fc129

commit_message:
Release python-ironic-inspector-client for wallaby

Propose a release for python-ironic-inspector-client for Wallaby, even if no change really
warrants it, as we need a tag to start the stable branch from.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.3.0..3c03e21
3c03e21 Remove redundant items from CI jobs
c4919b8 Update minversion of tox
03ce642 Move pep8 dependencies from test-requirements to tox.ini
4a92b65 Remove lower-constraints job
9d93604 Set safe version of hacking
d6c40b7 Use python 3.8 in functional tests
3a562a8 Fix l-c job
659c4e4 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
e9ce216 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Change-Id: I6977c691931828863e19203b918231acaf64ded4

commit_message:
Release sushy-cli for wallaby

Propose a release for sushy-cli for Wallaby, even if no change really
warrants it, as we need a tag to start the stable branch from.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 0.3.1..9116165
c83c9b0 Update minversion of tox
a091b0c remove unicode from code
d8df4aa Remove lower-constraints job
8600a08 Fix lower-constraints with the new pip resolver
5bbd929 Set safe version of hacking
dd6cc37 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
36ecad2 Update master for stable/victoria

Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Change-Id: I28cccf5cc075b38b476213c360b0e100b6e42a1d

We had a further round of testing to double-check one thing. This patch seems to be okay but it requires setting `OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True`, right? Seems like this is what breaks our tests and increases number of failures from ~0 to ~11.

Can we have some help with debugging the problem on our gates?"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-03-11 10:57:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 11:
> 
> > Patch Set 11:
> > 
> > Michal - thanks for testing, and file bug(s) if you see further issues so we can track down if it's in the provider or core OVN.
> 
> We had a further round of testing to double-check one thing. This patch seems to be okay but it requires setting `OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True`, right? Seems like this is what breaks our tests and increases number of failures from ~0 to ~11.
> 
> Can we have some help with debugging the problem on our gates?

Is it required to build OVN from source in order ot use SCPT LBs?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:57:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 11:
> 
> > Patch Set 11:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 11:
> > > 
> > > Michal - thanks for testing, and file bug(s) if you see further issues so we can track down if it's in the provider or core OVN.
> > 
> > We had a further round of testing to double-check one thing. This patch seems to be okay but it requires setting `OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE=True`, right? Seems like this is what breaks our tests and increases number of failures from ~0 to ~11.
> > 
> > Can we have some help with debugging the problem on our gates?
> 
> Is it required to build OVN from source in order ot use SCPT LBs?

It depends on the OVN version.  From what I remember, the gate will use Ubuntu Focal (20.04) which is only at OVN 20.03 (?) but we really want OVN 20.06 to get a selector field patch.  That's why I had to change the OVN provider gate to build things, else it was failing all the UDP tests.  What version of things are running in your gate?"}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-03-12 02:48:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I see that in the gates we currently define v20.06.1[1], however I don't think that has been really enforced since the ovn option of OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE(defaults to False) was recently introduced[2] and we didn't enable that on the gates. We starting seeing the failures when enabling the OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE in order to test sctp.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/.zuul.d/sdn.yaml#L144
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent#L75"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-12 03:03:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> Patch Set 11:
> 
> I see that in the gates we currently define v20.06.1[1], however I don't think that has been really enforced since the ovn option of OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE(defaults to False) was recently introduced[2] and we didn't enable that on the gates. We starting seeing the failures when enabling the OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE in order to test sctp.
> 
> [1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/.zuul.d/sdn.yaml#L144
> [2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/master/lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent#L75

In the OVN provider jobs we define these:

    OVN_BUILD_FROM_SOURCE: True
    OVN_BRANCH: v20.06.0
    OVS_BRANCH: v2.13.0

So I would think later would be Ok as well.

When you don't specify for it to build OVN can you tell from the logs what version is getting installed?"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2021-03-12 07:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2021-03-12 10:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add SCTP support

The Octavia API supports 'SCTP' as a protocol when creating
listeners and pools, so add it to OVN_NATIVE_LB_PROTOCOLS.
Core OVN already has support for SCTP.

Required a bump in octavia-lib version to pick-up constant.

Change-Id: Ica57a5c77af61bffba812b35608bfc2a90011ba8

subject: Make rabbitmq prometheus plugin config optional
messages:
[{'account_id': 32140, 'date': '2020-07-21 15:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32140, 'date': '2020-07-21 16:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Related bugs:
1810763
1885106

When outward_rabbitmq is enabled deployment fails because prometheus is enabled by default on new rabbitmq images. The second container fails to start because port is already in use.

With this change we allow customization of prometheus port in rabbitmq.conf as suggested on rabbitmq-prometheus project on github: https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-prometheus#configuration

I have set this configuration flag in ansible/group_vars/all.yml:

rabbitmq_configure_prometheus_port: "{{ enable_outward_rabbitmq | bool }}"

So if outward rabbitmq is enabled, this triggers the configuration of prometheus port to avoid conflicts. If users use a custom built rabbitmq image without prometheus-plugin, they have to set this flag to "no"'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-22 11:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

please squash with the previous change, thank you'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-12 16:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Squashed into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/738123'}]

commit_message:
Update requirements for wallaby release

Updates requirements to be consistent (mostly) with os-brick and
python-cinderclient.  Also revises the lower-constraints file to
contain only direct dependencies.

commit_message:
Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Conflicts:
	manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)

subject: zuul: Set CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER explicitly to tgtadm for grenade jobs
messages:
[{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-10 12:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-10 12:46:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to lioadm'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a note: victoria is already based on Focal. This is maybe more a matter of defaults being set. Maybe you just need to set tgtadm as default on the stable/victoria branch (the upgrade should not change the configuration).'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:39:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

and if we set this to tgtadm in master (so wallaby), it wouldn't reflect what the deployment does"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-10 14:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> and if we set this to tgtadm in master (so wallaby), it wouldn't reflect what the deployment does

I'm not sure what you're trying to say here.

It's currently set in the shared local.conf used by devstack to currently deploy stable/victoria and then upgrade to master. If it's initially set to tgtadm on stable/victoria it *has* to be set to tgtadm on master regardless of what devstack master deploys by default."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:36:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > and if we set this to tgtadm in master (so wallaby), it wouldn't reflect what the deployment does
> 
> I'm not sure what you're trying to say here.
> 
> It's currently set in the shared local.conf used by devstack to currently deploy stable/victoria and then upgrade to master. If it's initially set to tgtadm on stable/victoria it *has* to be set to tgtadm on master regardless of what devstack master deploys by default.

I don't think so. Grenade doesn't change the configuration, it only switch to the new code with the existing configuration. Before running the upgrade, the deployment happens using the devstack of the starting branch, which is stable/victoria."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:52:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/grenade/+/779807'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2021-03-10 16:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

The discussion is going on on the etherpad of the cinder meeting, and grenade logic with old/ and new/ is always a bit complicated. I'm removing my vote for now, but a note:"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-10 16:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-11 23:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-12 16:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

If57c54828baf4e250ad08fdd95351490010e1b41 should remove the need for this in grenade, both the old and new deployments can use lioadm.'}]

[{'created': '2021-03-10 12:25:08.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: Set CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER explicitly to tgtadm for grenade jobs

While grenade jobs are based on Bionic we need to ensure that the tgtadm
backend is used for both the original deployment and during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I3960c24665ace97989ea78673f4ef38f38f9d754
'}, {'created': '2021-03-10 17:10:05.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: Set CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER explicitly to tgtadm for grenade jobs

While grenade jobs are based on Bionic we need to ensure that the tgtadm
backend is used for both the original deployment and during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I3960c24665ace97989ea78673f4ef38f38f9d754
'}]
commit_message:
zuul: Set CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER explicitly to tgtadm for grenade jobs

While grenade jobs are based on Bionic we need to ensure that the tgtadm
backend is used for both the original deployment and during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I3960c24665ace97989ea78673f4ef38f38f9d754

commit_message:
[reno] Stop publishing release notes

Since we copy all release notes to the integrated repo there is not need
in publishing release notes for each repository. We should only verify their
validity and linting.

Depends-On: Ia88b8e606a19ad8ee20665e125df1079b0a771ff
Change-Id: I997bb15f5bdd3714df9ac42f9252d16b3a059825

commit_message:
Remove references to unsupported operating systems

All references to Gentoo, SUSE, Debian stretch and Centos-7  are removed.
Conditional tasks, ternary operators and variables are simplified where possible
OS specific variables files are generalised where possible

Depends-On: Ia88b8e606a19ad8ee20665e125df1079b0a771ff
Change-Id: I1ad5aaaad5a8184d1a6aa41300bd6060fa6bc0e6

[{'created': '2021-03-09 12:02:25.000000000', 'message': 'Move _ovs_additional_ids() and sequence_functions() to charmhelpers

Sync charmhelpers.

Replace _ovs_additional_ids() calls with generate_external_ids() from
charmhelpers.

Replace sequence_functions() with sequence_status_check_functions()
from charmhelpers.

This allows to share helper functions between charm-neutron-gateway
and charm-neutron-openvsiwtch.

Signed-off-by: Przemysław Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I8fc3b5c9e33e539b8b9c1d188acb8c79e8758244
'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 12:05:51.000000000', 'message': 'Move _ovs_additional_ids() and sequence_functions() to charmhelpers

Sync charmhelpers.

Replace _ovs_additional_ids() calls with generate_external_ids() from
charmhelpers.

Replace sequence_functions() with sequence_status_check_functions()
from charmhelpers.

This allows to share helper functions between charm-neutron-gateway
and charm-neutron-openvswitch.

Change-Id: I8fc3b5c9e33e539b8b9c1d188acb8c79e8758244
Signed-off-by: Przemysław Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Move _ovs_additional_ids() and sequence_functions() to charmhelpers

Sync charmhelpers.

Replace _ovs_additional_ids() calls with generate_external_ids() from
charmhelpers.

Replace sequence_functions() with sequence_status_check_functions()
from charmhelpers.

This allows to share helper functions between charm-neutron-gateway
and charm-neutron-openvswitch.

Change-Id: I8fc3b5c9e33e539b8b9c1d188acb8c79e8758244
Signed-off-by: Przemysław Lal <przemyslaw.lal@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

    [1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I18774f1d4faf3cf3a9d5783d36af47d1ee3361c2
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update Gates for Airshipctl Changes

Image phases were changed per:
https://review.opendev.org/c/airship/airshipctl/+/777726

Only necessary work was to override
document entry points for new (to us)
phases.

Change-Id: Id6c51f1b077fb7172d0d00573797d57ee4972f32

subject: Remove some duplicate methods
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 22:41:43.000000000', 'message': "Remove some duplicate methods

Randomly looked at this:

https://lgtm.com/projects/g/openstack/openstacksdk/snapshot/586b57287544a3f99648b4f084967101afff708f/files/openstack/connection.py?sort=name&dir=ASC&mode=heatmap#xc1301a782f6760ae:1

(don't ask)

But - the methods sure are duplicates of the ones we broke out into
openstack/cloud/_identity.py

Also - the super call in a class with no parents is dumb.

Change-Id: I98b0360239e53143aa9e8d38d69df9d70a337801
"}]
commit_message:
Remove some duplicate methods

Randomly looked at this:

https://lgtm.com/projects/g/openstack/openstacksdk/snapshot/586b57287544a3f99648b4f084967101afff708f/files/openstack/connection.py?sort=name&dir=ASC&mode=heatmap#xc1301a782f6760ae:1

(don't ask)

But - the methods sure are duplicates of the ones we broke out into
openstack/cloud/_identity.py

Also - the super call in a class with no parents is dumb.

Change-Id: I98b0360239e53143aa9e8d38d69df9d70a337801

This makes sense but I'm not quite clear on, doesn't this mean any project using ceph on stable branches will be broken, that is, should the version not be pinned in a central place like in the plugin itself so that all get the needed pinning?"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-03-11 19:35:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This makes sense but I'm not quite clear on, doesn't this mean any project using ceph on stable branches will be broken, that is, should the version not be pinned in a central place like in the plugin itself so that all get the needed pinning?

More specifically, I'm thinking of the $TARGET_BRANCH related code in:

https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh

and

https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/blob/master/devstack/lib/ceph

I think I just need some help understanding why we should pin the release per project and not set a working default for all somewhere in the plugin if $TARGET_BRANCH is one that cannot tolerate a newer ceph version."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-03-11 19:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Apologies I tried to explain this in the commit, the plugin based jobs are pinned. nova-live-migration and nova-grenade-multinode however are not based on these jobs and manually configure ceph via the hook scripts I've modified here. It actually resulted in these jobs using an older release that I don't think was intended tbh.

FWIW I'm trying to replace both of these in master with plugin derived jobs."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-03-11 19:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks and apologies again for not making this all clear in the commit.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-03-12 11:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

we discussed a few options for this on irc yesterday such as pinning the ceph plugin to a specific commit amoung other options. this uses a native facility of the plug to choose the ceph verision to install which i think is a reasonable way to approch this problem the only caveat i would have is that we need to ensure that the ceph plugin is not modified in a backward incompatable way going forward that would break nautilus support unless we also pin.

this makes sense to me however and we can cross pinning the version later if we need too.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-03-12 11:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

CI fix patch, unblocks stable/train. To pin ceph release to 'nautilus' looks OK to me."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 15:17:06.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] gate: Skip ceph tests after plugin moved to Octopus release

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by skipping the ceph tests within the live
migration hook used by both of these jobs.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
'}, {'created': '2021-03-11 15:40:03.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] gate: Pin CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus in LM hook

I1edd5a50079f325fa143a7e0d51b3aa3bb5ed45d moved the branchless
devstack-plugin-ceph project to the Octopus release of Ceph that drops
support for py2. As this was still the default on stable/train this
breaks the nova-live-migration and nova-grenade jobs.

This change works around this by pinning the CEPH_RELEASE to nautilus
within the LM hook as was previously used prior to the above landing.

Note that the devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job from the plugin repo
continues to pass as it is correctly pinned to the Luminous release that
supports py2.

If anything the above enforces the need to move away from these hook
scripts and instead inherit our base ceph jobs from this repo in the
future to avoid the Ceph release jumping around like this.

Change-Id: I1d029ebe78b16ed2d4345201b515baf3701533d5

Add hirsute and remove trusty from metadata.yaml

removes trusty support (14.04 which is EOL at 21.04).

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If1a5ab04a5dbd51f86377ec32f95797b551e66ab
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If1a5ab04a5dbd51f86377ec32f95797b551e66ab

commit_message:
Allow longer timeouts for elasticsearch.service

/usr/lib/systemd/system/elasticsearch.service comes with a
TimeoutStartSec=75, which is not enough time for a somewhat busy
E5-2430L v2 @ 2.40GHz to get things going.

We don't want to permanently override that with a default of 75 in
case they decide to bump or remove that timeout in the future.

Change-Id: Ida8668f5548a15a8f597839bd9002585aeea5d1a

commit_message:
Add export system configuration

This change adds support for exporting system configuration. The
configuration of the entire system or individual subsystems, such as
iDRAC, BIOS, NIC, and RAID, can be exported.

Change-Id: Ia7db0223d72566cf4a4d013a35ef2782f273695f
Co-Authored-By: Sonali Borkar <sonaliborkar85@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 13:42:23.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)
'}, {'created': '2021-03-03 07:45:44.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will

To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)

commit_message:
Add chart hook in job manifests

When try to upgrade, facing problems because of immutable fields in job
manifests. By adding hook-deletion-policy, we can avoid such problems.
Plus, added a label with application=service_name to enable filtering
jobs by service name

Change-Id: I1e5c7460b840bcffa88264716e0489f8ba7c17b9

commit_message:
cinder: add boto3 dependency

cinder in master requires boto3 now, otherwise you get:

   File "/home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/cinder-17.1.0.dev218/cinder/backup/drivers/s3.py", line 74, in <module>
     import boto3
   ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'boto3'

Change-Id: I05f8c8458f13ab18e68b248689a513682ef50f38

commit_message:
Enforce TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE to be a string at all times

It can happen that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE gets interpreted as a boolean
and not as a string. This has the consequence that python
when calling subprocess.run() will call os.fsencode() on the
boolean variable and we can get the following error:

    "error": "Traceback (most recent call last):\n  File \"/tmp/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload__m7cmu0z/ansible_tripleo_diff_exec_payload.zip/ansible/modules/tripleo_diff_exec.py\", line 123, in run\n  File \"/
usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 423, in run\n    with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process:\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 729, in __init__\n    restore_signals, start_new_session
)\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/subprocess.py\", line 1275, in _execute_child\n    env_list.append(k + b'=' + os.fsencode(v))\n  File \"/usr/lib64/python3.6/os.py\", line 800, in fsencode\n    filename = fspath(f
ilename)  # Does type-checking of `filename`.\nTypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not bool\n",
    "invocation": {
        "module_args": {
            "command": "/var/lib/container-config-scripts/pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh cinder_volume openstack-cinder-volume openstack-cinder-volume Started",
            "environment": {
                "TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE": true
            },

Let's force it to be a string so we can never hit this.

Tested on the provided reproducer.

Change-Id: Ia4caa36a6edd865b3e1dcdf9254c7f183b64faaf
Closes-Bug: #1918111
(cherry picked from commit bdd2cfe2dfab6b7cd203211ba2adfb71a0aee27d)

commit_message:
Run pre deploment tasks after applying network configurations

This change makes pre deployment tasks (ExtraConfigPre and
NodeExtraConfig) run after network configurations, to restore the
previous behavior in Queens, which uses SoftwareDeployment to apply
network configurations.

Closes-Bug: #1907214
Change-Id: I246a313c79b7866213ea478ec92750a42a04ae69

commit_message:
Disable TLS proxy for periodic Fedora job

In this job (and this OS), deployment fails as ovsdb-server can not read
the tls certificates (it runs as openvswitch user and files are
user-readable only, owned by stack user). Disable tls-proxy service for
it, not needed anayway as it focuses on Neutron testing and not OVS.

Change-Id: Ibea391d503658ec738a60e34e19bdd6d809c845c
Closes-Bug: #1911128

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-23 13:45:51.000000000', 'message': '[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/ip_conntrack.py

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS FW] Clean conntrack entries with mark == CT_MARK_INVALID

In case when security group is removed from port, connections
established to/from port which were hitting some of the removed SG
rules will be marked with CT_MARK_INVALID in the conntrack table.
Due to that such existing connections will be stopped.
But then if SG will be added again to the port, those conntrack entries
marked as invalid will not be removed and those hang connections will
not be revived.
To fix that, this patch adds deletion of the conntrack entries marked
with CT_MARK_INVALID and related to the port of which SG are
updated/added.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/ip_conntrack.py

Closes-Bug: #1915530
Change-Id: I84718b8ac4d8d6e39426e1c4485c2d7fe28185dd
(cherry picked from commit 1e220d7136965acbfe50215d982cac0bd3dcf9c3)

commit_message:
Separate nodes of FT and split FT

Cherry-picked the following commits from the master branch.
No functional changes are included.

In scenario tests, tests needed server to boot from volume
does not actually booth from volume.

self.create_server function use common create_test_server function to create
server but does not pass 'image_id' as None or empty string to make sever
to boot from volume.
create_test_server function use the default image if 'image_id'
is not passed.

This commit fix volume boot tests to boot server from volume not from image.

Change-Id: I8b6650f2ab5e6f6bff39f879ec4d24e1583e46d6
Closes-Bug: #1528990
"}]
commit_message:
Fix scenario tests for boot from volume cases

In scenario tests, tests needed server to boot from volume
does not actually booth from volume.

self.create_server function use common create_test_server function to create
server but does not pass 'image_id' as None or empty string to make sever
to boot from volume.
create_test_server function use the default image if 'image_id'
is not passed.

This commit fix volume boot tests to boot server from volume not from image.

Change-Id: I8b6650f2ab5e6f6bff39f879ec4d24e1583e46d6
Closes-Bug: #1528990

commit_message:
Updated RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot

StoryBoard story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008709
* Increased RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time
  to complete already running job. This is observed only for
  cross-boot scenarios like UEFI-BIOS and BIOS-UEFI.

Issue is observed on iDRAC firmware version: 4.22.00.00

Change-Id: Ice95c590e2c111020566de58bda18ff271a614e8

while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has

passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This

commit_message:
[stable-only] Fix legacy password handling

We pick some of heat legacy passwords (from heat resources),
while generating the passwords. However, if the plan has
been deleted from some reason and does not have the old
passwords as in the stack environment, this would result
in change of these passwords like RabbitCookie/PcsdPassword
and would lead to disruptions during deployment. This
patch fixes to only use them if they are not in the stack
environment.

This code has been removed from master after plan removal.

Closes-Bug: #1918566
Change-Id: I6b2f0ef916a950fe6f92ee4f8848bab92a7b1c85

commit_message:
Release blazar-nova for wallaby

Propose a release for blazar-nova for Wallaby, even if no change really
warrants it, as we need a tag to start the stable branch from.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.0..fb318e7
0b0cf72 Change dashes to underscore in setup.cfg
2bff1bc Remove six
28cca84 Sync requirements and lower-constraints with nova
ae65a5c Add doc/requirements
6434f21 Fix lower-constraints job
d399fe7 Update hacking for Python3
c41c700 Add Python3 wallaby unit tests
349e75a migrate testing to ubuntu focal

Signed-off-by: Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org>
Change-Id: Ib80adbdb33cc802339279ba87de81d69ffc5d824

commit_message:
Use no_log in ceph-admin-user-playbook

When creating and interacting with the private key for
the ceph-admin user use no_log in order to protect the
sensitive data.

Change-Id: Ibadd21c00787ce219dda34439948a02599fb671c

[{'created': '2021-03-12 11:08:00.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic6cb5dd2d98e8ccc61f6e5aac8f46366741d0315
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic6cb5dd2d98e8ccc61f6e5aac8f46366741d0315

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: If2aed34fede92809f7cd3b17183fa73264114f95

commit_message:
Revert "Re-use rpc transport"

This reverts commit 7d131c96d11799a463e8e8e0d15251175fb48ea1. We are
seeing oslo_messaging.exceptions.MessageUndeliverable errors after
several hours of runtime in DevStack.

Change-Id: I464f5388646de0220b9309d5200060fe5a146eb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 19:15:32.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix security service configuration for LDAP servers

This patch fixes some issues with LDAP client configuration on
ONTAP SVMs. With ldap security service, users should be able to
configure a LDAP client that can be used for authentication and
name mapping. The name service switch order remains: ldap,files.
Issues fixed:
- The driver now identifies when user provide a Active Directory
  domain or a Linux/Unix LDAP server IP and sets the correct schema.
- LDAP configuration parameter `servers` was replaced by `ldap-servers`
  in ONTAP 9.2, and now accepts host names too.
- Fix DNS configuration for LDAP security service
- User can now specify base search DN for LDAP queries, which can be
  mandatory for Unix/Linux servers, using the security service `ou`
  parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1916534
Change-Id: Ieaa53abbe50e7b708e508c132dfc4bb36b71a4f5
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix security service configuration for LDAP servers

This patch fixes some issues with LDAP client configuration on
ONTAP SVMs. With ldap security service, users should be able to
configure a LDAP client that can be used for authentication and
name mapping. The name service switch order remains: ldap,files.
Issues fixed:
- The driver now identifies when user provide a Active Directory
  domain or a Linux/Unix LDAP server IP and sets the correct schema.
- LDAP configuration parameter `servers` was replaced by `ldap-servers`
  in ONTAP 9.2, and now accepts host names too.
- Fix DNS configuration for LDAP security service
- User can now specify base search DN for LDAP queries, which can be
  mandatory for Unix/Linux servers, using the security service `ou`
  parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1916534
Change-Id: Ieaa53abbe50e7b708e508c132dfc4bb36b71a4f5
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add the base class DHCPResponder

This patch adds the base class for DHCPv4 and DHCPv6
responder. It centralized some common functions.

Partially-Implements: bp/distributed-dhcp-for-ml2-ovs
Related-Bug: #1900934

Change-Id: Ic4be066dfbc33d0fd99fec50fd54d4866232d286

commit_message:
Propose to move osprofiler to independent

Project did not have any change merged over the cycle, maybe it is time
to transition it independent.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
transition and we will process right away. If the team doesn't agree,
leave a -1 with some detail on the status, then we will cut the Wallaby
stable branch for this project.

Change-Id: I737a3ffa065247d2d581a26bf8a6605adf3b75e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-14 20:41:39.000000000', 'message': 'Addition of share shrinking feature to Manila-UI

Currently, share shrinking feature in Manila-UI is not supported.
Only "Extend Share" feature exists. "Extend Share" feature was
renamed as "Resize Share" and share shrinking feature was added.
Now it works both ways, if value in "New Size" field is less than
original size, it will shrink, and if value is more it will extend.
Also, minimal value was added to "New Size" field to ensure the
value doesn't decrease to zero.

Implements: blueprint share-shrinking
Change-Id: I8553bed01b529c1b3a57b1e900d171db1d5f28d2
'}, {'created': '2020-12-14 20:52:44.000000000', 'message': 'Addition of share shrinking feature to Manila-UI

commit_message:
Addition of share shrinking feature to Manila-UI

Currently, share shrinking feature in Manila-UI is not supported.
Only "Extend Share" feature exists. "Extend Share" feature was
renamed as "Resize Share" and share shrinking feature was added.
Now it works both ways, if value in "New Size" field is less than
original size, it will shrink, and if value is more it will extend.
Also, minimal value was added to "New Size" field to ensure the
value doesn't decrease to zero.

Implements: blueprint share-shrinking
Change-Id: I8553bed01b529c1b3a57b1e900d171db1d5f28d2

commit_message:
Branching is now considered, line numbers are printed

Coverage reports now include line numbers of statements
without tests.
Branch coverage is now calculated along with statement coverage.

For example:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/803463/

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I04da75b1ff4c80deace4cb752c7a30641467240f

subject: Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 09:12:32.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I861be072466943b11f0b8237f9698bd1ad311fcb
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I861be072466943b11f0b8237f9698bd1ad311fcb

commit_message:
Cinder Ceph Replication tests

* Add optional parameter `pools` to the Juju actions: `resync-pools`,
  `status`, `demote`, and `promote`.
* Add `bionic-train-image-mirroring` to the `gate_bundles`.

Change-Id: I9df77be628718bb60a1bdc65078c94d0b7bda9d4
Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/486

commit_message:
Remove dns servers from server_signal template

There is no way to overwrite dns servers list, so
remove them to use cluster network settings directly.

Change-Id: I08350018d348684256d32b5f37117c21babc6ab5

commit_message:
Switch to collections.abc.*

The abstract base classes previously defined in 'collections' were moved
to 'collections.abc' in 3.3. The aliases will be removed in 3.10.
Preempt this change now with a simple find-replace:

  $ ag -l 'collections.($TYPES)' | \
      xargs sed -i 's/\(collections\)\.\($TYPES\)/\1.abc.\2/g'

Where $TYPES is the list of moved ABCs from [1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html

Change-Id: Ia282479bb1d466bd2189ebb21b51d91e89b9581e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[Victoria and bellow] Ensure rights on the ansible.log file

When mistral starts the Ansible action, a log file is created runtime.
But nothing takes care of its access right, leading to potential data
leaks to unprivileged users (default mode is 0644).

This patch creates the logfile beforehands, and sets the needed rights
on it.

Change-Id: I024ff0a23823adfa2a2d354d44c7949df1f123da
Closes-Bug: #1918138

Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.

Still I see two issues with this:
- At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.
- Non-disruptive share migration should not target a new share server, but stay on the same one.'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2021-02-15 20:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.
> 
> Still I see two issues with this:
> - At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.
> - Non-disruptive share migration should not target a new share server, but stay on the same one.

Thanks for the heads up on these issues, Carthaca!
Wrt the issue with creating shares from snapshot, I'm testing this behavior locally, but as per the description, doesn't seem like a behavior caused by this change. I'll circle back with some more info. If that is confirmed, I'd say we should file up a bug and then work on it in parallel.
About the issue with share migration: we could work around this behavior by adding a flag which whould help us to identify if a given share is being migrated and allow the limits to be exceeded. It'd work if we take for granted that the source should be deleted after the share migration gets completed. 
I'd say it's important to bring more opinions to this discussion and see which approach we should go down with."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-03-06 19:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.
> 
> Still I see two issues with this:
> - At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.

Is this potentially an issue we need to worry about with other backends besides NetApp? I would think cloning across share servers is something most backends wouldn't support - atleast not easily, it may be breaking the tenancy model in the storage. On ONTAP, you can "rehost" volumes (which the netapp driver does in case of moving snapshot clones away from the source) - but since that comes in from a different code path, we should perhaps either:
- Ignore the limit or provide a way to override the option specifically for snapshot clones (preserving current behavior)
- Fail the operation instead of attempting to create a new server since a limit has been reached


> - Non-disruptive share migration should not target a new share server, but stay on the same one.

Ack, I'm confused how this is working today'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-03-06 20:53:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.
> 
> Still I see two issues with this:
> - At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.

Hi carthaca, can you provide more details regarding 'creating a share from snapshot not working if parent is not in the same share server'? Is this related to these new share server limits?

Makes sense you prefer to cross share server limits if cloning from snapshot in the same aggregate, since you will save data that are shared among them. This could work in the code only if we add a new option, since the function is backend agnostic.

> - Non-disruptive share migration should not target a new share server, but stay on the same one.

I agree, the code needs to handle this scenario. When migrating a share within the same share server, we don't need to check these limits since the source share will be deleted at the end of the migration process. Thanks for pointing this issue."}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2021-03-07 21:53:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

+1 for the migration thing being an issue. Will work on that."}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-03-08 06:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

looks good.'}, {'account_id': 18816, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 2:
>

> > 
> > Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.
> > 
> > Still I see two issues with this:
> > - At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.
> 
> Hi carthaca, can you provide more details regarding 'creating a share from snapshot not working if parent is not in the same share server'? Is this related to these new share server limits?
> 
> Makes sense you prefer to cross share server limits if cloning from snapshot in the same aggregate, since you will save data that are shared among them. This could work in the code only if we add a new option, since the function is backend agnostic.

Let's say I allow only 1 share per share server.
I have created share A with snapshot A that reside in share server A.
If I create a new share B now with providing the snapshot ID of A: in _provide_share_server_for_share() the list of available share servers will only contain parent share server A - done by get_available_share_servers() - and _check_share_server_backend_limits() filtering will remove share server A, so the list of available_share_servers will be empty, compatible_share_server will be None and a new share server B will be created (and for NetApp it will fail later on volume-clone-create, because the parent share is in a different vserver)."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > Hi Carlos, thanks for the adjustments.
> > > 
> > > Still I see two issues with this:
> > > - At least on NetApp creating a share from snapshot is not working if the parent share is not in the same share server. Downstream I decided to allow shares from snapshot on the same share server despite crossing the limits.
> > 
> > Hi carthaca, can you provide more details regarding 'creating a share from snapshot not working if parent is not in the same share server'? Is this related to these new share server limits?
> > 
> > Makes sense you prefer to cross share server limits if cloning from snapshot in the same aggregate, since you will save data that are shared among them. This could work in the code only if we add a new option, since the function is backend agnostic.
> 
> Let's say I allow only 1 share per share server.
> I have created share A with snapshot A that reside in share server A.
> If I create a new share B now with providing the snapshot ID of A: in _provide_share_server_for_share() the list of available share servers will only contain parent share server A - done by get_available_share_servers() - and _check_share_server_backend_limits() filtering will remove share server A, so the list of available_share_servers will be empty, compatible_share_server will be None and a new share server B will be created (and for NetApp it will fail later on volume-clone-create, because the parent share is in a different vserver).

Hi Maurice,

I now see the error that you are getting. Since share server A has reached its limit, the share from snapshot will land in a new share server, but both (new and parent) instances will have the same 'host'. According with the current NetApp implementation, it will fail because we are not checking both 'share_server' and 'parent_share_server' while creating from snapshot[1]. This is actually a bug on NetApp driver implementation, which we'll need to fix in a different patch, and doesn't invalidated this one. I can provide a new patch to fix that soon, I just need to test it here. Thanks again.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/1515701df06111b824c0e144aec31f0820d591ec/manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py#L546-L553"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-03-11 18:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > > 
> > > Hi carthaca, can you provide more details regarding 'creating a share from snapshot not working if parent is not in the same share server'? Is this related to these new share server limits?
> > > 
> > > Makes sense you prefer to cross share server limits if cloning from snapshot in the same aggregate, since you will save data that are shared among them. This could work in the code only if we add a new option, since the function is backend agnostic.
> > 
> > Let's say I allow only 1 share per share server.
> > I have created share A with snapshot A that reside in share server A.
> > If I create a new share B now with providing the snapshot ID of A: in _provide_share_server_for_share() the list of available share servers will only contain parent share server A - done by get_available_share_servers() - and _check_share_server_backend_limits() filtering will remove share server A, so the list of available_share_servers will be empty, compatible_share_server will be None and a new share server B will be created (and for NetApp it will fail later on volume-clone-create, because the parent share is in a different vserver).
> 
> Hi Maurice,
> 
> I now see the error that you are getting. Since share server A has reached its limit, the share from snapshot will land in a new share server, but both (new and parent) instances will have the same 'host'. According with the current NetApp implementation, it will fail because we are not checking both 'share_server' and 'parent_share_server' while creating from snapshot[1]. This is actually a bug on NetApp driver implementation, which we'll need to fix in a different patch, and doesn't invalidated this one. I can provide a new patch to fix that soon, I just need to test it here. Thanks again.

This could be an issue with other backends besides NetApp. The code you indicate can change and handle volume rehost and do the right thing here; but hard for us to know if other backends are able to support that. Please go ahead and raise a launchpad bug to address this in the NetApp driver - Carlos, can we add a doc addendum in a separate patch to suggest that "create_share_from_snapshot" has not been tested to work alongside limits for all backends. I think we should also test this for the Generic driver and open a similar bug if that doesn't work - i suspect it won't have a problem since we call into cinder for performing the snapshot cloning, and the cinder volume should be available to attach in the newer server. 

> 
> [1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/1515701df06111b824c0e144aec31f0820d591ec/manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py#L546-L553'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2021-03-11 19:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> If it fails, I'll just create a new bug and update the documentation as you suggested.

Thanks Carlos - no need to act on my inline comments right away; we'll see what turns out from your testing and how we can close the loop on the NetApp issue this patch partially causes. I agree with Douglas that we shouldn't attempt to fix it in this patch; we can establish the behavior intended and do our best to test with the backends that are available to us. This is the sort of thing that's very hard to test via tempest too.. because it involves toggling backend config options that we don't have any way of doing (and we don't want to given tempest is about establishing the behavior via the API). We can bring this up with other DHSS=True backend vendors via the mailing list in the coming weeks. This is the sort of thing that's very hard to test via tempest too.. because it involves toggling backend config options that we don't have any way of doing (and we don't want to given tempest is about establishing the behavior via the API). We can bring this up with other DHSS=True backend vendors via the mailing list in the coming weeks. If their backends can't handle this, we'll look for a way to expose that functionality and fail as fast and early as we're able to.

Yeah, I'm all for bringing this up to the wider community so they can check how is it going to impact them. We can work on a fix for it in the NetApp driver ASAP.

Also, I have managed to finish testing with the generic driver.
Basically:
- I've specified low backend limits so I'd be sure that the share from snapshot would be created in another share server
The Generic driver managed to create a share from snapshot even if it wasn't in the same share server.

commit_message:
Add share server limits

Add two new capabilities to manila. It is possible to set limits
to share server size and share instances in a share server by
setting `max_share_server_size` and `max_shares_per_share_server`
in a backend stanza.

Change-Id: I3170478d3aa2d09cb2adc32233dc57bc59029a56
Partially-Implements: bp new-share-server-limits
DocImpact

commit_message:
Upgrade ansible-lint to 5.0

- remove role name rule as is included in newer versions
- added .cache folder to git ignore (used by linter)
- enabled optional yamllint run on ansible-lint
- assured repository has a valid root requirements.yml (so linter can make use of it)
- assured that we do not mix playbooks with non playbooks inside same folders
- renamed undocumented "role" argument received by import_role to official "name".
- added mocked roles/modules to avoid linter errors (ideally they should be provided by
  requiremetns.yml).

Change-Id: I14b855f8a15afccaf4973e2a612aa7e9eae3bfa5

commit_message:
cors-tests: Increase timeouts for setup operations

Drive-bys:
* Only copy outputs when there are outputs to copy
* Print tracebacks when there's an issue running a selenium driver

Change-Id: I0807af4525a13a30baf27ada40eeabe311b44296

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-19 10:27:30.000000000', 'message': 'Pure: Add default value to pure_host_personality

Pure's "pure_host_personality" configuration option currently defaults
to a non valid value according to its choices.

This affects tools leveraging the "get_driver_options" mechanism, since
the default value for the option was not considered a valid option.

This patch sets the default explicitly and adds it as a valid choice.

Change-Id: I381b80920d812a3f3b5f75b6dae66aa932f6baa4
(cherry picked from commit 69f4f5ffe44dfa219ecde975180bd26ed5f62377)
'}]
commit_message:
Pure: Add default value to pure_host_personality

Pure's "pure_host_personality" configuration option currently defaults
to a non valid value according to its choices.

This affects tools leveraging the "get_driver_options" mechanism, since
the default value for the option was not considered a valid option.

This patch sets the default explicitly and adds it as a valid choice.

Change-Id: I381b80920d812a3f3b5f75b6dae66aa932f6baa4
(cherry picked from commit 69f4f5ffe44dfa219ecde975180bd26ed5f62377)

>

I know that submitting multiple tests in a patch is not good, but I don’t have a local environment for tox testing. I will pay attention next time. 
Actually I want to fix the lower-constraints job in this one https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/+/769634."}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-03-10 11:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

You can make small venv to see how lower constraints go with new pip resolver with a command like:
python3.8 -m venv foo &&  foo/bin/pip install -U pip && foo/bin/pip install -c lower-constraints.txt -r test-requirements.txt -r requirements.txt 

Failures are then easy to fix/spot, timeouts can be helped a lot by updating minimum versions on packages that generate a lot of backtrack. Checking the other neutron and stadium projects can be useful too as most changes will be similar'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2021-03-11 12:21:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

The patch https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/+/769634 is green now, so this is not necessary anymore"}, {'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2021-03-12 07:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

(3 comments)

I'm not familiar with neutron but this patch feels too small to me. :) 

By looking at the code I see places where specific things are done based on the vnic_type of the port like:

* resetting mac when unbindig a direct physical port [1]. Do we need to do the same for accelerator_direct_physical?
* rejecting port update for direct physical port [2]. Do we need the same for accelerator_direct_physical?
* also in the sriov mech_driver.py where I commented inline

commit_message:
[SR-IOV] Add support for ACCELERATOR_DIRECT VNIC type

Add support in SR-IOV mechanism driver for VNIC type
"accelerator-direct".

This VNIC type refers to any device that supports hardware
acceleration of any kind and is provided by Cyborg [1].

NOTE: "accelerator-direct-physical" is not supported yet.

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cyborg

Change-Id: I529e6a2a445a140dca7686976efeefcd13d333f0
Closes-Bug: #1909100

subject: Part 5 - Add RBAC protection tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-10 23:29:28.000000000', 'message': 'Part 5 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- share servers (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share snapshots (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share snapshot export locations (GET)
- share snapshot instances (GET, POST)
- share snapshot instance export locations (GET)

Change-Id: I0a70426560bd5a76866215f67431c771fe63b8d4
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Part 5 - Add RBAC protection tests

This change enforces API policy
scenarios with unit testing and ddt.
It uses keystone middleware unlike
existing policy tests that use the
noauth middleware.

These tests should serve as protection
tests when making policy/API changes.

This change adds tests for the following
API groups:
- share servers (GET, POST, DELETE)
- share snapshots (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- share snapshot export locations (GET)
- share snapshot instances (GET, POST)
- share snapshot instance export locations (GET)

Change-Id: I0a70426560bd5a76866215f67431c771fe63b8d4
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
