commit_message:
Flood broadcast to dhcp tunnels

The patch makes sure broadcast traffic is sent not only to EVPN
tunnels, but for original neutron tunnels with DHCP. Mirror
rule for ARP responder with higher priority than flooding.

Closes-Bug: #1915522
Change-Id: Ia5f4d33421f12ffacf88764da8a1bc4659c4a398

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 12:52:04.000000000', 'message': 'Mech driver Resource Provider UUID5 namespaces should be different

Each mechanism driver Resource Provider namespace should be different.

commit_message:
Mech driver Resource Provider UUID5 namespaces should be different

Each mechanism driver Resource Provider namespace should be different.
Despite the Resource Provider UUID will be generated randomly, based
on this namespace, the hostname and the interface name, we should
provide a different namespace UUID per mech driver.

Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: Icea46cc3056185cec720e11e4d0f3a2e292cb952

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-08 13:38:47.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" option in the Logical Switch
Ports in the OVN driver. Without this option, the ovn-controller will
consume the IGMP queries and won't send it to the LSP ports, meaning
that external IGMP queries will never arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Set mcast_flood_reports on LSPs

This patch enables the "mcast_flood_reports" and "mcast_flood" (on provnet
ports only) options in the Logical Switch Ports in the OVN driver. Without
these options, the ovn-controller will consume the IGMP queries and won't
send it to the LSP ports, meaning that external IGMP queries will never
arrive to the VMs.

In talks to the core OVN team, it was suggested [0] to enable the
"mcast_flood_reports" option by default in the OVN driver (at least until
fixed in core OVN) as a workaround to this problem. And, to avoid having
to update all ports (which can be many) based on the igmp_snooping_enable
configuration option, we are always setting "mcast_flood_reports" to
"true" in the LSPs. This won't cause any harm (also confirmed by core
OVN developers [0]) since it will be ignored if multicast snoop is
disabled.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1933990#c3

Closes-Bug: #1918108
Change-Id: I99a60b9af94b8208b5818b035e189822981bb269
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER explicitly for tgtadm job

Required to allow the default of CINDER_ISCSI_HELPER to change for
Ubuntu based hosts to lioadm without breaking these tgtadm jobs.

Change-Id: Ie9ca822f53abf90052ddfae52852b8b78c910ece

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 16:57:29.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775
(cherry picked from commit 6231d26667508e34eb0a985f1f7ced1dbe623e1a)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Retry delete if VolumeIsBusy in _copy_image_to_volume

Cinder can fail to create an image-based volume if RBD mirroring
is enabled. With the journaling-based approach to RBD mirroring,
ceph will still create a snapshot as a result of volume creation.
The volume create in _create_from_image_download() results in
a snapshot getting created, resulting in a race where delete_volume()
gets a VolumeIsBusy exception.

Change-Id: Ib80e04512ec34a390e9e17af2f3544e18cad8598
Closes-Bug: #1900775
(cherry picked from commit 6231d26667508e34eb0a985f1f7ced1dbe623e1a)

commit_message:
Update SolidFire Storage assisted migration in support-matrix

Storage assisted volume migration for NetApp SolidFire driver was
merged in Victoria release cycle [1]. This patch updates the
support-matrix to claim driver support to the feature.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/746941

Change-Id: I87fb30b7faddf615d6df4401de444b9d9f7cb2e2
(cherry picked from commit 1156c89c2fb37d68dc3eba5b2f453706facb3336)

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for share type extra spec

This commit updates the policies for share type extra spec to understand scope
checking and account for a read-only role. This is part of a broader series of
changes across OpenStack to provide a consistent RBAC experience and improve
security.

Change-Id: Ib2f71bdbe22f092016df25a7118abf3337f8cb8d

commit_message:
Pure Storage: check volumename length does not exceed maximum

Add in checks to ensure volume names in all cases, including
snapshotting and unmanaging, do not exceed the name length
limits on the FlashArray

Change-Id: I6c153fd6c9c0f485092a82f0e6ae020ec5980fcc
Closes-Bug: 1870103
(cherry picked from commit bb219d6b9f62cc549cb9fe38b60e5e0b5aa450cf)

commit_message:
[goal] Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file

As per the community goal of migrating the policy file
the format from JSON to YAML[1], we need to do two things:

1. Change the default value of '[oslo_policy] policy_file''
config option from 'policy.json' to 'policy.yaml' with
upgrade checks.

2. Deprecate the JSON formatted policy file on the project side
via warning in doc and releasenotes.

Also replace policy.json to policy.yaml ref from doc and tests.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: I595b8c7cad7bb02486c8f0dd29fdc40789fc8e50

Will dig some more, but the only place I can see it getting pinned is in the python-cinderclient repo where lower-constraints.txt shows tempest==26.0.0 - why is that?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-03-09 19:41:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Switch to new rolevar for run-temepst role

Tempest replaced the below rolevar for run-tempest role
- tempest_test_blacklist is replaced by tempest_test_exclude_list
- tempest_black_regex is replaced by tempest_exclude_regex

old name are still supported for compatiblity but we recommend
to switch to new one.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/774835
Change-Id: Iaa398e20575729c82c14a0a00d3992b88ccdfce8

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-05 15:41:35.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

Also notice that the tox targets `docs` and `releasenotes` pointed on an
inexisting requirement file and this patch fix that too.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I393690dab717e0783f6181396a68d28b272845d3
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

Also notice that the tox targets `docs` and `releasenotes` pointed on an
inexisting requirement file and this patch fix that too.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I393690dab717e0783f6181396a68d28b272845d3

Turns out the relinker's relink and cleanup command can take a while so
it would be nice to have progress added to the log file.

This patch adds an info level log line to the relinker log once a

commit_message:
Relinker: Add partition progress to relinker log

Turns out the relinker's relink and cleanup command can take a while so
it would be nice to have progress added to the log file.

This patch adds an info level log line to the relinker log once a
partition is completed. It looks something like:

  Device: sda1 Step: cleanup Partitions: 1/2

So from a glance we can see what device, what step and the progress. In
the above snippet it's just finished the first of 2 partitions.

Change-Id: I364b37ca77a5b6d6125a1f133efa255340316949

commit_message:
Correctly set member operating status

According to the Octavia API, a provider driver should
set the member operating_status field to OFFLINE on a
create if admin_state_up=False in the call. The OVN
provider wasn't looking at that flag, so always had
operating_status set to NO_MONITOR (the default when
health monitors are not supported).

Also, when a member is updated from admin_state_up=False
to True, operating_status must show NO_MONITOR since no
health monitor is configured and the status is unknown.

Change-Id: Idca5e682894b237649a24ceb5092605102f9bfff
Closes-bug: #1906568

commit_message:
Refactor heat identity client

Currently, when Heat sets up its identity client for testing,
it asks for user and project domain names and ids regardless of
Keystone auth version. Since domains were introduced in v2, this
can lead to an error. This change moves this check so that it
only occurs if the user is running these tests using Keystone v3.

Change-Id: Ib33dd0456944db05a62b020c1c292e05a0586321

[{'created': '2014-02-13 15:44:55.000000000', 'message': 'Adds gateway ip address to external gateway info

Right now you are able to get external gateway information for neutron router.
The information we can get is network_id and snat. We want to be able to get
the ip address of the router external gateway. This patch adds ip address to
external_gateway_info attribute.

Change-Id: Ia5026113c151588b8bdead3a7febcd3c6944891b
'}]
commit_message:
Adds gateway ip address to external gateway info

Right now you are able to get external gateway information for neutron router.
The information we can get is network_id and snat. We want to be able to get
the ip address of the router external gateway. This patch adds ip address to
external_gateway_info attribute.

Change-Id: Ia5026113c151588b8bdead3a7febcd3c6944891b

commit_message:
Add hide_create_volume option to defaults

If you were ever looking for a way to hide this button, the
feature was added in Stein, via https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/605813

The default is False, and astute users will see this setting and
override it in their user_variables.yml if needed.

Change-Id: I293c3a8e806f7af3b540afa3d2040ec73e925008

commit_message:
Pure Storage: check volumename length does not exceed maximum

Add in checks to ensure volume names in all cases, including
snapshotting and unmanaging, do not exceed the name length
limits on the FlashArray

NOTE: This had to be manually amended as the original commit used
a version of ddt not supported in Victoria

Change-Id: I6c153fd6c9c0f485092a82f0e6ae020ec5980fcc
Closes-Bug: 1870103
(cherry picked from commit bb219d6b9f62cc549cb9fe38b60e5e0b5aa450cf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 16:35:23.000000000', 'message': 'Allow multiple token labels for PKCS#11 driver

This patch changes the slot selection logic to look for more than one
token label in the list of slots, using the first token that is found.

This change is required to enable load balancing with devices that
use separate tokens for this feature.

This patch adds a new option in the [p11_crypto_plugin] section
"token_labels", and deprecates the "token_label" option.

For backwards compatibility, the "token_label" option will still be used
if present.

Change-Id: Ic2b85246c37e856c38cb47613313b19e653118de
(cherry picked from commit 1ca03610d7257c782b11d6bcf54074d66a79c545)
(cherry picked from commit b41ceaa369e2bdd5b75d76c0a3368854293ed03a)
(cherry picked from commit 7cf483e205736483b4999abfe4baf6f626fff862)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow multiple token labels for PKCS#11 driver

This patch changes the slot selection logic to look for more than one
token label in the list of slots, using the first token that is found.

This change is required to enable load balancing with devices that
use separate tokens for this feature.

This patch adds a new option in the [p11_crypto_plugin] section
"token_labels", and deprecates the "token_label" option.

For backwards compatibility, the "token_label" option will still be used
if present.

Change-Id: Ic2b85246c37e856c38cb47613313b19e653118de
(cherry picked from commit 1ca03610d7257c782b11d6bcf54074d66a79c545)
(cherry picked from commit b41ceaa369e2bdd5b75d76c0a3368854293ed03a)
(cherry picked from commit 7cf483e205736483b4999abfe4baf6f626fff862)

subject: Lock sg updates while in _apply_port_filter()
messages:
[{'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-03-11 00:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-03-11 15:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-03-11 20:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Clean backport'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-11 00:20:54.000000000', 'message': 'Lock sg updates while in _apply_port_filter()

Add a locking mechanism so that security_groups_member_updated event
processing is blocked if another thread is in the process of applying
port filters.  This avoids a race condition where security group
membership updates are incorrectly discarded when they arrive between
retrieving port details and registering the port with the firewall
driver.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1887405 for complete
details.

Bug: 1887405
Change-Id: I6e4abe13a7541c21399466c5eb0d61ff5780c887
(cherry picked from commit 5cc8f16a588d7e40c3e696e6739d8ada907f0116)
'}]
commit_message:
Lock sg updates while in _apply_port_filter()

Add a locking mechanism so that security_groups_member_updated event
processing is blocked if another thread is in the process of applying
port filters.  This avoids a race condition where security group
membership updates are incorrectly discarded when they arrive between
retrieving port details and registering the port with the firewall
driver.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1887405 for complete
details.

Bug: 1887405
Change-Id: I6e4abe13a7541c21399466c5eb0d61ff5780c887
(cherry picked from commit 5cc8f16a588d7e40c3e696e6739d8ada907f0116)

commit_message:
Lock sg updates while in _apply_port_filter()

Add a locking mechanism so that security_groups_member_updated event
processing is blocked if another thread is in the process of applying
port filters.  This avoids a race condition where security group
membership updates are incorrectly discarded when they arrive between
retrieving port details and registering the port with the firewall
driver.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1887405 for complete
details.

Bug: 1887405
Change-Id: I6e4abe13a7541c21399466c5eb0d61ff5780c887
(cherry picked from commit 5cc8f16a588d7e40c3e696e6739d8ada907f0116)

commit_message:
compute: Remove 'file://' prefix from '--block-device'

There are a couple of other (networking-related) options which accept
paths, none of which insist on a URI-style path. Let's just drop this
bit of complexity before we release the feature.

Change-Id: Ia7f781d82f3f4695b49b55a39abbb6e582cd879c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Workaround client race in legacy nested stack delete
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-07 02:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-07 03:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2019-12-23 18:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-01-01 16:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 02:56:09.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround client race in legacy nested stack delete

When we delete a legacy stack, the delete call may return when a previous
delete is still IN_PROGRESS and we are waiting for it to be cancelled - for
up to 250s by default plus the time it takes to kill any remaining threads.
This means that if the client subsequently sees a DELETE_FAILED status, it
can be ambiguous as to whether it refers to the previous delete or the one
it just commanded.

Work around this when Heat itself is the client (i.e. we are deleting a
nested stack).

First, put the time the delete started into the status_reason message when
the stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so that we can
distinguish.

Then, require the stack to report its status as DELETE_FAILED twice in a
row, 10s apart, before we mark it as failed - unless we have definitively
seen a different delete commence in the meantime.

Change-Id: Ie23ba5f4538a8f5c2e7d64caa6cbe530c013b520
Story: #1669608
Task: 17214
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 03:56:30.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround client race in legacy nested stack delete

distinguish.

Then, require the stack to report its status as DELETE_FAILED twice in a
row, 10s apart, before we mark it as failed - unless we have definitively
seen a different delete commence in the meantime.

Change-Id: Ie23ba5f4538a8f5c2e7d64caa6cbe530c013b520
Story: #1669608
Task: 17214

When we delete a legacy stack, the delete call may return when a previous
delete is still IN_PROGRESS and we are waiting for it to be cancelled - for
up to 250s by default plus the time it takes to kill any remaining threads.
This means that if the client subsequently sees a DELETE_FAILED status, it
can be ambiguous as to whether it refers to the previous delete or the one
it just commanded.

Work around this when Heat itself is the client (i.e. we are deleting a
nested stack).

First, put the time the delete started into the status_reason message when
the stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so that we can
distinguish.

Then, require the stack to report its status as DELETE_FAILED twice in a
row, 10s apart, before we mark it as failed - unless we have definitively

commit_message:
Workaround client race in legacy nested stack delete

When we delete a legacy stack, the delete call may return when a previous
delete is still IN_PROGRESS and we are waiting for it to be cancelled - for
up to 250s by default plus the time it takes to kill any remaining threads.
This means that if the client subsequently sees a DELETE_FAILED status, it
can be ambiguous as to whether it refers to the previous delete or the one
it just commanded.

Work around this when Heat itself is the client (i.e. we are deleting a
nested stack).

First, put the time the delete started into the status_reason message when
the stack goes into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state, so that we can
distinguish.

Then, require the stack to report its status as DELETE_FAILED twice in a
row, 10s apart, before we mark it as failed - unless we have definitively
seen a different delete commence in the meantime.

Change-Id: Ie23ba5f4538a8f5c2e7d64caa6cbe530c013b520
Story: #1669608
Task: 17214

messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 16:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 17:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-27 18:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Rico, any help getting these errors resolved? Looks like they are not related to these changes. This is needed to get the final rocky release out and close out the rocky stable branch for EM.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-01 15:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 16:56:42.000000000', 'message': "Configure 'earliest-version' for release notes

For some reason, reno is attempting to find tags on branches that don't
have them. While we resolve that, set an earliest release, avoiding the
need to build release notes for the broken branches.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715479/
Change-Id: I75841d0dcb8e69214b7e96cf04f8b095da4d81d2
"}, {'created': '2020-03-27 17:47:46.000000000', 'message': "Ignore old 'vN-branch' tags when scanning for release notes

reno has an open TODO [1] to sort branches by something other than
alphabetical order. Unfortunately we're hitting this here since heat
previously had a 'vN-branch' branch naming scheme, and reno thinks those
branches are newer than e.g. 'stable/train'.

The solution is to just be stricter in how we select our branches and
tags, preventing those with hyphens in them from being accepted.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/reno/blob/3.0.0/reno/scanner.py#L850-L852

Change-Id: I75841d0dcb8e69214b7e96cf04f8b095da4d81d2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore old 'vN-branch' tags when scanning for release notes

reno has an open TODO [1] to sort branches by something other than
alphabetical order. Unfortunately we're hitting this here since heat
previously had a 'vN-branch' branch naming scheme, and reno thinks those
branches are newer than e.g. 'stable/train'.

The solution is to just be stricter in how we select our branches and
tags, preventing those with hyphens in them from being accepted.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/reno/blob/3.0.0/reno/scanner.py#L850-L852

Change-Id: I75841d0dcb8e69214b7e96cf04f8b095da4d81d2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Disable Load Balancers panel when Octavia service is not deployed

Currently Load Balancers panel is enabled based on 'network' service
defined in Keystone but it should refer to 'load-balancer' service
which is served by Octavia.

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for secretstore API

    Add new system scope specific RBAC rules for the secretstore API.
    The new rules allow all roles to list and get secret stores.

[{'created': '2021-03-10 10:22:56.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints job

lower-constraints job is broken. Requirements are rarely changed
in stable branches and dropping lower-constrants job from stable
branches was discussed in the mailing list. It looks safe to drop
it in stable branches. Octavia already dropped lower-constraints
job in stable branches and this change follows it.

Change-Id: I86579c7359c6a44871aa154a1563050b1024ac63

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

lower-constraints job is broken. Requirements are rarely changed
in stable branches and dropping lower-constrants job from stable
branches was discussed in the mailing list. It looks safe to drop
it in stable branches. Octavia already dropped lower-constraints
job in stable branches and this change follows it.

Change-Id: I86579c7359c6a44871aa154a1563050b1024ac63

subject: Adjust modules path for Neutron test containers
messages:
[{'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-23 11:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-02-23 15:08:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It appears this changes between bionic and focal. May or may not be worth varying this dependent on the distribution.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-03-11 09:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-11 12:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Whilst /usr/lib/modules doesn't exist on bionic, /lib is a symlink to /usr/lib on focal. Fedora did this couple years back, and now ubuntu are probably following suit.

https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/systemd/TheCaseForTheUsrMerge/"}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-03-11 12:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Perhaps swap the logic and assume /usr/lib unless it's old bionic. Next LTS will probably use this new convention."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-03-11 21:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Current path uses a symlink which the LXC process refuses to
bind mount due to security checks.

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints job

lower-constraints job is broken. Requirements are rarely changed
in stable branches and dropping lower-constrants job from stable
branches was discussed in the mailing list. It looks safe to drop
it in stable branches. Octavia already dropped lower-constraints
job in stable branches and this change follows it.

Change-Id: I86579c7359c6a44871aa154a1563050b1024ac63
(cherry picked from commit 6f2ef772b041249f92f5a3f3c6fbfa9cc332a91c)

commit_message:
Move "Domain" field under "User Name" and "Password"

Autofocus on the login screen now is on the first field. It's either
"User Name" or "Domain" with multidomain support. However it appears
to be more convenient to keep the focus on "User Name" whether there
is multidomain support or not. Also "Domain" is pre-filled with the
last domain used, so often there's no need to change it.

This patch moves "Domain" field under "User Name" and "Password" and
keeps autofocus always on "User Name".

Closes-Bug: #1916958

Change-Id: I590ce3a5cbaa0ebb470228a7114a60ff89467835

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-09 19:40:13.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Contemplate deprecating one of the force delete volume policies

An administrator can forcibly delete a volume using two different APIs.
The first is the volume actions API and the second is DELETE
/v3/volumes/{volume_id} after microversion 3.23.

Each API has a separate policy for enforcing authorization even though
they ultimately offer and protect the same functionality.

This commit deprecates one of the policies. This is solely to start a
discussion about the feasibility of consolidating options like this.

In the worst case scenario, an operator has overridden one of the two
policies in a way that makes them inconsistently enforced. This could
lead to unintentionally opening up functionality.

Change-Id: I63b10cd749837b539deae7cd07c771d7864588df
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Contemplate deprecating one of the force delete volume policies

An administrator can forcibly delete a volume using two different APIs.
The first is the volume actions API and the second is DELETE
/v3/volumes/{volume_id} after microversion 3.23.

Each API has a separate policy for enforcing authorization even though
they ultimately offer and protect the same functionality.

This commit deprecates one of the policies. This is solely to start a
discussion about the feasibility of consolidating options like this.

In the worst case scenario, an operator has overridden one of the two
policies in a way that makes them inconsistently enforced. This could
lead to unintentionally opening up functionality.

Change-Id: I63b10cd749837b539deae7cd07c771d7864588df
